loan.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy Q. is from the city of Banadero Ozamiz City. She is 43 years old and married with one school-aged child. To make a living, Ludy runs a tricycle transportation service. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.
In 2007, Ludy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from GDMPC and is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP to repair her vehicle for better service. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Ludy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family.
About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to repair her vehicle for better service

loan.name: Ki

texts.en:
Ki S., 25, is a farmer and produces traditional baskets, earning an income of $2 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend $60 on food, $10 on electricity supply and $10 on other necessary expenses every month.
Her husband is a tuk-tuk (a motorized, three-wheeled taxi) driver, earning an income of $3 per day.
S. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase business hours at the airport to provide transportation services. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loan.use: To buy the business hours at the airport to provide transportation services

loan.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua S. is a baker in Abura. She sells millet porridge as well. She is divorced and has five dependents. She sees to the well-being of her home with the income she makes from her sales.
Her loan will be added to her initial capital to buy more baking ingredients to increase productivity to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to take care of her dependents.
In this photo, Ekua is showing how she serves the millet porridge to her customers.

loan.use: Her loan will be added to her initial capital to buy more baking ingredients to increase productivity

loan.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel S. is from the village of San Andres. He is 43 years old. Samuel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Samuel plants and harvests rice for sale. Samuel has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Samuel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Samuel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Samuel is requesting a new loan of 32,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Samuel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loan.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius P. is from the village of Brgy. Banganan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 24 years old. Julius is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Julius raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Julius has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) when he sells one of his raised animals. In 2009, Julius joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julius has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Julius is requesting a new loan of 24,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the second loan taken out by Julius from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loan.name: Phourn

texts.en:
Phourn S., 31, sells Chinese noodles, earning an income of $20 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple.
The family has to spend $40 on food, $10 on electricity supply and $70 on other necessary expenses every month. Her husband is a carpenter, earning an income of $17 per day.
S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more materials to improve her husband's carpentry business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loan.use: Buy more materials to improve her husband's carpentry business

loan.name: Bolor-Erdene

texts.en:
Bolor-Erdene S. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Hovd province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in their own house with fence. His two children both attend a local secondary school.
Bolor-Erdene operates a meat-trading business in his town with help of his wife. He started his own business in 2003 by operating a raw-material trading business with help of his brother-in-law. After several years of operation, he has managed to establish himself in the business community and his business earnings have enabled him to buy a mini truck for his business. They travel thorough the countryside to purchase raw materials and exchange those products for foodstuffs. For the future, he plans to purchase more products in order to expand his sales.
Bolor-Erdene says, "I want to remodel my house, but I travel through (the) countryside a lot; therefore, I don't have much time to improve my house." He is requesting a 2,600,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) loan in order to purchase more livestock skins and wool as well as livestock and meats from herders for his business.

loan.use: To purchase more livestock skins and wool

loan.name: Pich

texts.en:
Pich D., 36, is a housewife. D. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple.
The family has to spend $50 on food, $15 on electricity supply, and $20 on other necessary expenses every month. Her husband is a traditional musician, earning an income of $10 per day. D. is requesting a loan of $600 to rent a stand at the market and to purchase groceries to stock the store.
In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loan.use: Rent a stand at the market and purchase groceries to stock the store

loan.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
As the saying goes, opportunity knocks only once. Mary Grace S. M. knows this truth and grabs every opportunity that comes her way. Mary Grace, 46, reached the college level of education and is married to Rolando, a government employee. Together they are raising three children, two of whom are in high school while the other one is already working. Together, they live in Pasay City, Philippines.
Mary Grace presently runs a direct-selling business, in which she sells items to her neighbors. Her products include fashionable bags, accessories, apparel, cosmetics and footwear, among others. Having been at least 25 years in business, she knows how to pay her dues on time. She also has an excellent reputation with her fellow community partners in CCT* and, most important, her customers. Monthly, she is able to earn an average of 10,000 Philippines pesos (Php).
To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She intends to use this money to purchase more products for her store, all the more now that the Christmas season is fast approaching. She plans to take this opportunity to drive her business toward more profitability.
Mary Grace's life is never without challenges, both in her business and personal life. Nonetheless, she stays focused on the opportunities that lie ahead, and not on the failures of yesterday or the worries of today.
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loan.use: Stock for her direct-selling business and items ordered in advance by her customers

loan.name: Chav

texts.en:
Chav S., 48, sells vegetables by using her bike, earning an income of $2.50 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple.
The family has to spend $60 on food, $1 on electricity supply and $10 on other necessary expenses every month. Her husband produces traditional baskets to sell and is a construction worker, earning an income of $3 per day.
S. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loan.use: To buy a motorbike for the family use

loan.name: Ganzul

texts.en: Ganzul N. is a 27 year old young lady who lives with her mother in a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, and fence in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her mother, Tsedevsuren, is 66 years old and retired. Ganzul operates a barber shop in a rented space. Her work place is located next to a public bath house and attracts many customers. She has been working as a hairdresser since 2005. Her business has grown steadily over the years due to her loyal customers. After many years of owing this business, she has gained not only significant experience as a hairdresser, but also a wide-ranging customer base. For the future, she hopes to continue her business with stable operation and have her own hair salon. Ganzul is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary equipment, materials and tools from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

loan.use: To purchase necessary equipment, materials and tools

loan.name: Munoru

texts.en:
Munoru K. is 60 years old and married to Rachael, who contributes to the family income through farming. He has been running his dairy farm for a period of ten years with an income of Kshs.10,000 per month.
This is his third loan from KADET LTD. He successfully repaid the previous loans. He plans to use this loan to buy animal feed. He hopes to venture into greenhouse farming and be a leading farmer. His goal is to give his children a quality education and improve their living standard.

loan.use: To buy animal feed

loan.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey L., 19, is a cook, earning an income of 3 USD per day. L. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend 45 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity, and 25 USD on other necessary expenses every month. L. is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. L. appears in the photograph with her mother.

loan.use: To buy a motorbike to commute to work

loan.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam E., 49, sells flowers and lemon grass, earning an income of 15 USD per day. E. is married and resides with her husband and a child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend 40 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity, and 30 USD on other necessary expenses every month. E. is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to purchase more flowers and lemon grass to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loan.use: To buy flowers and lemon grass to resell

loan.name: Henrik

texts.en: Henrik G. has been trading in jewelry for three years. Henrik purchases jewels and golden cast sections of jewelry and then places orders to make the final product. The demand for jewelry is growing now in the pre-holiday season as people rush to buy gifts. Henrik has applied for this loan to increase his jewelry stock.

loan.use: Increase his jewelry stock

loan.name: Ivy

texts.en:
As an active entrepreneur, Ivy has been running a sari-sari store for almost a year. Building her business, Ivy would like to receive a loan of 10,000 PHP to increase the inventory of goods sold in her sari-sari store. She is planning to purchase additional products such as rice, sugar, eggs, cooking oil and other stocks of her store. Ivy believes that offering a wide assortment of goods to customers will increase traffic to her store and maintain customer loyalty in their village.
Since the course of her membership in Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Ivy has been a model member, demonstrating regular attendance to weekly center meetings and steady repayments on previous loans.
Her long term goals are to offer a better future for her family and sustain the profitability of her store. Through hard work and determination, Ivy is focused on improving her quality of life with the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders.
Her future goals are to purchase a new jeepney. By owning her own transportation, Ivy will save time and money going to market to buy supplies for her store. With her hard work, focus, and determination, Ivy is hopeful that her business will continue to be more productive and improve her quality of life, out of poverty.
She also dreams of owning a house and lot free from flooding, of completing the college education of her children and finding great jobs in the future.
She says Salamat (native dialect means Thank You) to all Kiva supporters for open hands and hearts for the poor women who want to pursue dreams in life, like her. She prays that they should be blessed.

loan.use: To purchase additional products such as rice, sugar, eggs, cooking oil and other stocks of her store

loan.name: Alfonce Waithome

texts.en:
Alfonce Waithome is 34 years old. He is married to Mary Kanini and together they have two children, Mwikali and N., aged three and one year respectively.
He distributes and sells sugar, cooking oil, detergent and other goods along Kangundo, Tala road. Alfonce has been running this business for a period of eight years and his monthly profit is Kshs 15,000. Alfonce was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Tala office.
This loan of Kshs 30,000 is his third loan from KADET and he plans to use the loan to increase his stock of sugar, cooking oil and detergent. With the increased revenue, he will pay school fees for his children.
Alfonce dreams of having a wholesale shop one day. He describes himself as hardworking.

loan.use: To increase stocks of sugar, cooking oil and detergent.

loan.name: Suy

texts.en: Suy R., 51, is a grocery seller, earning an income of 7 USD per day. R. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend 45 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity, and 20 USD on other necessary expenses every month. R. is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loan.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loan.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi E. prepares kenkey for sale at Abura. Esi has received a senior high education. She is single, but takes care of 10 dependents. She is responsible for the welfare of her home. Esi is asking to use the loan to purchase more maize to prepare kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her dependents.
In this photo, Esi is in the process of making the kenkey.

loan.use: To purchase more maize to prepare kenkey for sale

loan.name: Loah

texts.en: Loah L., 32, sells sugar cane juice, earning an income of USD 2 per day. L. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend USD 66 on food, USD 2 on electricity supply, and USD 15 on other necessary expenses every month. Her husband is a construction foreman, earning an income of USD 8 per day. L. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more supplies to improve her husbands business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loan.use: To buy more construction supplies

loan.name: Roberta

texts.en:
As the saying goes, opportunity knocks only once. Roberta J. knows this truth and grabs every opportunity that comes her way. Roberta, 67, reached high school and is a widow with six children. Five are already working and one lives at home. Together, they live in Pasay City, Philippines.
Roberta presently runs a sari-sari (variety) store, in which she sells items that are needed daily by neighbors in her community. Products on her shelves range from soap bars to candies and from energy drinks to rice. Having been at least 25 years in business, she knows how to pay her dues on time. She also has an excellent reputation with her fellow community partners in CCT* and, most importantly, her customers. Monthly, she is able to earn an average of PHP 9,000.
To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She intends to use this money to purchase more products for her store, all the more now that the Christmas season is fast approaching. Roberta plans to take this opportunity to drive her businesses toward more profitability.
Roberta's life is never without challenges, both in her business and personal life. Nonetheless, she stays focused on the opportunities that lie ahead, and not on the failures of yesterday or the worries of today.
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loan.use: To buy additional stock to replenish her inventory

loan.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en: Jargalsaihan D. is 34 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the Hovd province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in their own house and fence. His three children attend a local secondary school and his wife works as an assistant in the local dentist office. Jargalsaihan operates a meat and raw material trading business in his town. He started his own business in 2008 after working under raw materials traders for two years. He usually purchases his raw materials from a neighbor city, which makes his transportation costs high. Therefore, he plans to buy a new mini truck for his business in the future. Jargalsaihan is a hardworking, modest and optimistic person. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to buy more livestock skins and wool as well as meats from herders for his meat and raw material trading business.

loan.use: To buy more livestock skins and meat from herders

loan.name: Lem

texts.en: Lem C., 48, is a housewife. C. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend USD 75 on food, USD 3 on electricity supply, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month. Her husband is a security guard, earning an income of USD 3 per day. C. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase used clothes to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loan.use: To buy used clothes to resell

loan.name: Grace Nyambura

texts.en:
Grace is 54 years old. She is single and is a mother of two grown children. She makes a living by selling milk to the local residents of Kimende. She currently has one dairy cow that produces milk, and wants to expand her business by buying another dairy cow to increase milk production.
Grace has been in this business for 20 years and knows what quality of milk her clients want. She plans to build rental houses from the profits of this loan. Her hope and desire is to become a prominent business woman in Kimende center.

loan.use: To buy a dairy cow

loan.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua A. sells drinks, biscuits, toffees, doughnuts and other items at Abura. She is married and has six dependants. Her husband is a carpenter. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be added to her initial income to buy more groceries to sell to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loan.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loan.name: Erdene-Oyun

texts.en: Erdene-Oyun T. is 27 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent and fence in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband works for a brick making factory and her two young children both attend a local kindergarten. She currently operates a grocery trading business out of a stall at a local market. She started her business in 2008 selling only ice cream. After years of successful operation, she has expanded her business by increasing her product line to include a variety of food products. Today, her working capital exceeds 1,300,000 MNT. For the future, she hopes to grow her business and have her own shipping container. Her earnings have enabled her to start building a house in her yard. She says, "I hope to finish building my house by this coming spring." She is requesting a 1,950,000 MNT loan in order to import more fruits from China at wholesale price.

loan.use: To import more fruits from China at a wholesale price

loan.name: Damb (La Dignit) Group

texts.fr: Damb est un regroupement de femmes maries du quartier Koulikoro de la ville de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants, copouses et ayant en moyenne 34 ans et au moins 4 enfants. Ce groupe Damb fait lachat et la vente de produits alimentaires tels les fruits et lgumes et de la restauration. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activits, les membres du groupe ont dcid dintgrer le programme crdit de Soro Yiriwaso. Chitan Dembl qui est un des membres fait lachat et la vente des fruits et lgumes. Elle est trs sollicite car elle occupe une bonne place au march de lgumes de Mdina Koura. Elle compte utiliser son prt pour acheter, au fur et mesure des fruits et lgumes (ignames, patate douce, manioc, banane plantain, orange, mangue, ananas, etc.) avec les grossistes au grand march de Koutiala, pour les revendre en dtail et au comptant une clientle diverse varie. Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Damb comptent raliser un bnfice moyen de 55.000FCFA chacune au cours de ce cycle, Chitan Dembl elle, compte raliser 70.000 FCFA. En plus du remboursement des prts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu pour faire face aux dpenses courantes de la famille. Elles ambitionnent renforcer leur partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso pour mieux diversifier leurs activits.
texts.en:
Damb is a group of married women in the Koulikoro district of the town of Koutiala. They live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and co-wives. On average, they are 34 years old and have at least 4 children.
The Damb group is engaged in the purchase and sale of food products such as fruits and vegetables and in the restaurant business. In order to expand their business, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program.
Chitan Dembl, one of the members, sells fruits and vegetables. She is in high demand because she is located at a good place at the Mdina Koura vegetable market. She intends to use her loan gradually to purchase fruits and vegetables (yams, sweet potatoes, manioc, plantain bananas, oranges, mangos, pineapples, etc.) from wholesalers at the big market in Koutiala, to sell them retail for cash to a diversified range of customers.
While the other members of the Damb group expect to make a monthly profit 55,000 CFA francs each during this cycle, Chitan Dembl expects to make 70,000 CFA francs.
In addition to repaying the loans, they use a portion of the income to cover their families daily expenses. They aspire to reinforce their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to better diversify their business.

loan.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loan.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Mr. Byambasuren is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Currently they live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, on his grandmother's plot of land. His daughter attends a local secondary school and his son goes to kindergarten.
Mr. Byambasuren has been a policeman since 2001. He works in 2-day shifts: on for 24 hours and then off for two days. During his two off days, he works as a taxi driver, ferrying people around the city using his family car to make extra money. His wife works as a waitress in a small diner. They dream of buying a small family house in the future.
The taxi business gives them a chance to earn extra money to save. Mr. Byambasuren is requesting a loan to buy some spare parts and to properly service his car.

loan.use: To buy spare parts and to service car

loan.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is 27 years old. She operates a restaurant business in Tala market. She is a single mother of one son, John Mutisya, who is nine years old and is in class three. Mary's food pleases her customers a lot since its well-made, so she has many customers. Mary was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Tala office.
Mary has been running this business for a period of three years. Her monthly profit is Kshs 15,000. This loan for Kshs 10,000 is her first loan from KADET LTD. She intends to use it to buy chairs, tables, and cereals for cooking. If this loan boosts her business, Mary will use the profits to pay school and tuition fee for her child. She dreams of having a catering school. She describes herself as hardworking.

loan.use: To buy chairs, tables, and cereals for cooking.

loan.name: Gombo

texts.en: Gombo S. is 71 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent and fence in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His one child attends university while his wife and oldest son both help him with the business. He operates a vegetable growing and trading business where he plants and grows a variety of vegetables in his own 800 m/square field. With the help of his son and his wife, he sells those vegetables out of a rented stall at the local markets. He has been engaged this business for the past 15 years and has since built a stable and successful operation. Before starting his own business, he worked as an agronomist for the agricultural department until 1995, after graduating from Agricultural University as an agronomist. After many years of owing his business, he has gained a lot experience as a farmer and his earnings have enabled him to build a greenhouse in 2009. They plant a variety of special vegetables in the greenhouse. Gombo is a hardworking and experienced businessman and says, "People, when they are retired, they just stay at home and do nothing. People can not be retired, they can still work." He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary materials and supplies in order to pickle their vegetables.

loan.use: To purchase necessary materials and supplies to pickle vegetables

loan.name: Vladimir

texts.en: Vladimir B. has been involved in the production of meat products (pelmeni, khinkali, ishli kyufta, and so on) since 1998. Vladimirs wife helps him in the business. Through the years, Vladimir has consistently prepared high quality products, building up a permanent clientele. Vladimir requests a loan to enlarge his food production to meet increased demands during the Holiday Season.

loan.use: To increase food production

loan.name: Timothy Mbithi

texts.en:
Timothy N. is 34 years old. He has been operating a retail shop for a period of five years. He is married to Mary, who is a business lady. They have no children. He was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Tala office.
Timothy earns a monthly profit of Kshs 15,000 from his retail shop business. This loan of Kshs 50,000 is his fourth loan with KADET. He intends to use it to increase stocks of sugar, soft drinks, cooking fat and flour. If the loan boosts the business, he will save and expand his business further. He dreams of growing it into a wholesale business. He describes himself as hardworking.

loan.use: To buy sugar, soft drinks, cooking fat and flour to sell

loan.name: Kahangi Women In Development Group

texts.en: Evelyne is 40 years of age and a single mother of five children all below 18 years living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda .The responsibility to provide for the family is vested in her and her family dream is to educate her children. She has a retail shop and has been in business for eight years. This has enabled her to work towards her goal of educating the children. She is a member of Kahangi Women in Development, where each member guarantees the other. Evelyn needs to use the loan to buy alcohol to sell during the Christmas season.

loan.use: To buy alcohol to sell

loan.name: Francis Wambua

texts.en:
Francis Wambua is 30 years old. He sells electronics in Kangundo market. He also buys and sells cattle as a secondary business. He is married to Agnes, who is a farmer. Together they have a three-year-old son, Daniel. He was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Tala office.
Francis has been running this business for a period of two years. His monthly profit is Kshs 30,000. He has a very good credit history with KADET LTD. This loan for Kshs 50,000 is his fourth loan from KADET. He plans to use it on his secondary business to buy cows, goats and sheep to trade. If this loan boosts this business, he will buy household goods which they lack for their home, and expand his business further so that he will be able to pay school fees for his son.
Francis dreams of having his own company one day. He describes himself as hardworking.

loan.use: To buy cows, sheep and goats to trade

loan.name: Marciana

texts.en:
As the saying goes, opportunity knocks only once. Marciana G. knows this truth and grabs every opportunity that comes her way. Marciana, 56, has a high school education and is married to Ceferino, a bouncer. They are raising one child who is in high school. Together, they live in Pasay City, Philippines.
Marciana presently runs a direct selling business. Products range from household detergents, cosmetics, apparel and footwear, among others. Having been at least two years in business, she knows how to pay her dues on time. She also has an excellent reputation with her fellow community partners in CCT* and, most importantly, her customers. Monthly she is able to earn an average of Php5,000.
To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php12,000 loan. She intends to use this money to purchase more products for her direct selling business and other items ordered in advance by her customers all the more now that the Christmas season is fast approaching. She plans to take this opportunity to drive her businesses toward more profitability.
Marciana's life is never without challenges, both in her business and personal life. Nonetheless, she stays focused on the opportunities that lie ahead, and not on the failures of yesterday or the worries of today.
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loan.use: items ordered in advance by her customers on her direct selling business

loan.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa N. is a seamstress at Abura. Adjoa completed secondary education. She is single but has five dependents. She responsibly sees to the well-being of her home.
She is requesting to use the loan to buy more sewing materials to expand her business.
She hopes to save the new profits from her activities and to expand her business.

loan.use: To buy more sewing materials to expand her business

loan.name: Tsendadya

texts.en:
Tsendadya G. is 44 years old and lives with her husband, two children and grandchild in Uvurhangai Province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a house with a fence. Her son attends university and her husband works as a manager for the local savings bank.
Tsendadya operates a bakery production business in her town with the help of her daughter. She owns a bakery shop called "Uguuj" and produces a variety of pastries and breads for her local customers. She started her business in 2009 based on her previous experience of working in the different bakery shops in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.
In 2010, she signed with a government agency to supply meals to the local schools under a lunch program.
After years of operation, she has gained much experience as a business woman. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary equipments such as cooker, mixer and materials such as rice, sugar, flour, etc., for her bakery business.

loan.use: To purchase necessary equipments such as a cooker, mixer and materials

loan.name: Stephen Njoroge

texts.en:
Stephen has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last six years. He is 44 years old and is married to Mary Wanjiku. They are blessed with two school-going children.
He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend. This will be his second loan. He repaid his first loan of Kshs. 10,000 in full and in good time. He plans to use this loan amount to buy onion seedlings and pesticides, and to prepare the land for planting.
In the future, Stephen hopes to practice large-scale farming and be able to supply onions to the whole of Naivasha town.

loan.use: To buy onion seedlings & pesticides, and prepare land for planting

loan.name: Willium Juma

texts.en:
William has been in the quarrying business in Naivasha town for the past eight years. He is 28 years old and is married to Alice Akinyi. They have one school-aged child.
He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend who is also a member of KADET. This will be his second loan. He paid his first loan of KES 25,000 in full and in good time. He plans to use the loan to pay for manpower and to buy an extraction site.
In the future, William hopes to grow his business and supply building materials to the whole of Naivasha town.

loan.use: to pay for manpower and to buy an extraction site.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Buy a motorbike for the family use

loan.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng S., 28, sells bread, earning an income of USD 10 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkor Wat Temple. The family spends $30 on food, $10 on electricity supply, and $35 on other necessary expenses every month. Her husband is a carpenter, earning an income of USD 5 per day.
S. is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase a sugar cane squeezer to expand her business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.
his is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loan.use: buy a sugar cane squeezer to expand her food business

loan.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama Y. sells provisions at Abura. Ama has attained a senior high education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a chain saw operator. Ama has been selling provisions for three years. She assists her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions for resale. She hopes to reinvest the new profits.

loan.use: To buy more provisions for resale.

loan.name: Rach

texts.en: Rach P., 50, is a farmer earning an income of USD 4 per day. P. is married and resides with her husband and nine children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend USD 80 on food, USD 20 on electricity supply, as well as money for other necessary expenses each month. P. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase cows to help plow the rice fields. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loan.use: To buy cows to help plow the rice fields

loan.name: Nhov

texts.en:
Nhov S., 35, is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3.50 per day. S. is married and resides with his wife and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend USD 50 on food, USD 5 on electricity, and USD 35 on other necessary expenses every month.
S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more supplies to improve his construction business. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. This is his second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loan.use: buy more construction supplies

loan.name: Elizabeth Wanza

texts.en:
Elizabeth N. Ndalani is 46 years old and is married to Charles who contributes to the family income. She has a butchery which she has been operating for a period of nine years, generating an income of Kshs 30,000 per month.
This is her third loan from KADET LTD. She successfully repaid her previous loans. She hopes to have a big butchery that will supply meat to a larger customer base. She hopes to give her children a quality education and improve their standard of living.

loan.use: To buy 10 goats for slaughter

loan.name: Van

texts.en:
Van O., 35, is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1.60 per day. O. is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. Her husband is a recycler, earning an income of USD 4.10 per day. The family has to spend USD 70 on food, USD 2 on electricity, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month.
O. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike to transport recyclable materials to improve her husbands business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loan.use: buy a motorbike to transport recyclable materials

loan.name: Ireri Ene

texts.en:
Ireri has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the past 10 years. She is 39 years old and is married to Jaitoti Ole Kandet. They have two school-aged children.
She was introduced to KADET by her friend. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy 10 calves which she will rear and sell later at a profit.
In the future, Ireri hopes to practise dairy farming

loan.use: to buy 10 calves which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

loan.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea Mourn, 62, is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Mourn is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. The family has to spend USD 37 on food, USD 2 on electricity, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month.
Mourn is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. Mourn appears in the photograph with her daughter.

loan.use: buy groceries to sell

loan.name: George Oluoch

texts.en:
George has been in the quarrying business in Naivasha town for the past two years. He is 35 years old and is married to Lilian Achieng. They have three school-aged children.
He was introduced to KADET by his friend who is also a member of KADET LTD. This will be his second loan. He repaid his first loan of KES 25,000 in full and in good time. He plans to use the loan to buy an extraction site and boost his manpower.
In the future, George hopes his business will grow and get more tenders for supplying building stones to different institutions in Naivasha town.

loan.use: to buy an extraction site and boost man power.

loan.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna U. is a 54-year-old widow with three children. Her family has been engaged in cattle breeding and land cultivation for the past 17 years, as a means of subsistence.
Ernas hardworking efforts allowed her to develop a farm with two cows and ten sheep. She also cultivates beans and perennial herbs which serve as forage for her cattle. Now, Erna plans to use the loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz Soms to broaden her business by purchasing sheep and manure to fertilize her land. With the revenue from this investment, Erna plans to reconstruct her barn.
Bai-Tushum and Partners use Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loan.use: to purchase cattle

loan.name: Nov

texts.en:
Nov C., 25, sells rice, earning an income of USD 1.50 per day. C. is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. The family has to spend USD 81 on food, USD 2 on electricity, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month.
C. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase more rice to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. C. appears in the photograph.

loan.use: buy rice to resell

loan.name: Yeth

texts.en:
Yeth S., 29, is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2.50 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. Her husband is a fisherman, earning an income of USD 2 per day. The family has to spend USD 41 on food, USD 2 on electricity, and USD 3 on other necessary expenses every month.
S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase fertilizer to improve her farming business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loan.use: buy fertilizer to improve the farming business

loan.name: Caroline Mbula

texts.en:
Caroline is 35 years old and is married to Joseph who also contributes to the family income. She has been running a posho meal business (a porridge-like dish made from maize) and also practices crop farming as a secondary business. She has been doing this for about 10 years, generating an income of Kshs. 20,000 per month.
She has a good history with KADET and has never borrowed from any other MFI. This is her fourth loan from KADET LTD having successfully repaid her previous ones. She plans to use the loan to buy 30 bags of maize for sale in her posho meal. She hopes to be a regional cereals supplier and to give her children a quality education and improve their standard of living.

loan.use: to buy 30 bags of maize for sale

loan.name: Big

texts.en: Big S., 33, is a farmer, earning an income of USD 3 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for the rubber plantation. Her husband is a taxi-driver, earning an income of USD 6 per day. The family has to spend USD 41 on food, USD 3 on electricity supply, and USD 5 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a machine to cut firewood for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loan.use: To buy a machine to cut firewood

loan.name: Isabella Wanjiku

texts.en:
Isabella Wanjiku is 59 years old and is married to Michael C. who contributes to the family income. She has been a poultry farmer for five years, generating an income of 10,000 Kenya shillings per month.
She is taking a third loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying her previous loans. She hopes to be a leading poultry farmer and to give her children a quality education and improve their living standards.

loan.use: To buy broilers and a dairy cow

loan.name: Efren's Group

texts.en:
Efren T. Sr. is from the village of Barangcuag, Angadanan, Isabela. He is 57 years old. Efren is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Efren is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Efren operates a furniture making business, producing and selling cabinets and wardrobes to local businesses and community members. Efren has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2006, Efren joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Efren has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory. Efren is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Efren from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve his business.
About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to purchase additional inventory for making furniture

loan.name: Magamaga Development Group-Jinja

texts.en:
50-year-old Florence B. has been operating her retail shop in Magamaga, Jinja, for the last decade. She said she made the decision to start up this business in the face of dire circumstances that on many occasions rendered her helpless as to how to provide for her family. At that time she was more preoccupied with agriculture, a modest means of subsistence. Through the course of the past decade, she said hard work and determination have become her mantra.
Florence is happily married with 10 children. She said she has been selling mostly household necessities, and her clients are mostly people from the neighborhood. She said this business generates for her 180,000 shillings in weekly profit. Florence also earns side income from a sugar cane trading business.
With this loan, Florence said she will purchase more retail items to resell this Christmas season. She is a anticipating a boom in her business operations during this festive season. Florence belongs to Magamaga Development group-Jinja.

loan.use: To purchase more stock to resell

loan.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 38 years old. She is married to Joseph Mburu, who contributes to the family income. They have three children. She has been buying and selling fruits and vegetables for a period of nine years, earning an income of 3,500 Kenya shillings per month.
This is her second loan from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous one. With this loan, she plan to buy more pineapples and tomatoes to sell. She hopes to expand her business to supply a wider variety of fruits and vegetables, to give her children a quality education, and to improve their living standards.

loan.use: To buy pineapples and tomatoes to resell

loan.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old married man. He is from Lebanon. He is the father of three school-aged children. He is the main income provider for his family, with fifteen years of experience working as a farmer. He has been running his own farm since 2004, and he specially uses plastic tents to grow his products.
These tents allow him to better monitor product quality as well as grow his products for more months during the year. He works independently in his business. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed supplies such as seeds and fertilizers for his agricultural work. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%.

loan.use: to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work

loan.name: Budondo Development Association-Jinja Group

texts.en:
B. Feibe is a 61-year-old dairy farmer in Namizi-Jinja. She is one lady with the courage of her convictions. Despite her age, she exemplifies the diligence often expected in people on the sunny side of 35. Given the fact that most Ugandans in general drink milk, one can reasonably assume that her business is doing well. Needless to say, her business has indeed been making strides in the 13 years she has been operating it. She said to get established in this business, she received training and learned skills from a local agriculture advisory school.
Feibe also runs a small grocery store in Jinja Market. Her weekly profits equate to 80,000 shillings. Feibe is happily married with 11 children. She said with this loan, she will purchase another cow and improve her kraals. She belongs to Budondo Development Association-Jinja.

loan.use: To buy a cow and improve corrals

loan.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old man engaged to be married. He is from Lebanon. He has been working in the agriculture field for ten years, and he has been running his own farm since 2003. He works independently in his business and he lives on his own.
He cultivates vegetables and he purchases agriculture products from a local agriculture shop. He works hard to earn a good income to be able to prepare for his wedding and a home for his soon-to-be wife. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional agriculture tools needed to improve his business level and so his lifestyle. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his harvest for the coming season.

loan.use: to purchase additional agriculture tools

loan.name: Samwel Odhiambo

texts.en:
For the last eight years, Samuel has been in the mining business in Naivasha town. He is 51 years old and is married to Pamella Akinyi. They have six school-going children.
He was introduced to KADET by his friend who is a member of KADET. This will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to employ more labor and buy working tools.
In the future, Samuel hopes to purchase a lorry to transport his products to the market.

loan.use: To hire labor and buy working tools

loan.name: Esbon Opande

texts.en:
For the last eight years, Esbon has been in the mining business in Naivasha town. He is 38 years old and is married to Mary Achieng. They have four schooling-going children.
He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend who is a member of KADET. This will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to pay for labor and buy working tools.
In the future, Esbon hopes to purchase a vehicle to transport his products to the market.

loan.use: To pay for labor and buy working tools

loan.name: Cleopatra

texts.en:
Cleopatra R. is from the village of Tabon. She is 47 years old. Cleopatra is a group member of PMPC. Cleopatra is married and has three children. To make a living, Cleopatra operates a food vending business, selling a variety of different foods in the local community, most especially baked goods.
Cleopatra started her business only this year and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2010, Cleopatra joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cleopatra is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Cleopatra from PMPC.
She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family.
About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To buy ingredients to cook

loan.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita B. is from the village of Nipaan. She is 51 years old, married and has three children. To make a living, Cristita operates a business selling fish in the local community and a nearby town.
Cristita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Cristita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Cristita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.
About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To buy more fish to sell

loan.name: Evangelista

texts.es: Evangelista tiene 50 aos esta casada con el sr. Antoliano hace ms de 20 aos, tienen tres hijos. Tiene su despensa desde los 25 aos, los tres hijos estudian, uno esta en la secundaria y dos en la universidad estudian a la noche y de dia les ayudan a su madre en la despensa. Su negocio est bien ubicado frente a una cancha de ftbol donde todas las tardes los vecinos se recrean y a la vez son sus clientes. Su marido trabaja como capataz de una estancia ubicada a 15 km de su domicilio quien le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Necesita el crdito para la compra de azcar, fideos, yerbas, sidras por la aproximacin de las fiestas de fin de ao.
texts.en:
Evangelista is 50 years old. She has been married to Antoliano for more than 20 years and they have three children. Evangelista has owned a grocery store for 25 years. Her three children are studying. One is in high school and the other two are at university: they study at night and during the day they help their mother in the store.
Evangelista's business is well located opposite a soccer field where the neighbors play every afternoon and also buy from Evangelista's store.
Evangelista's husband works as a foreman on a ranch 15km from their home and helps her with their household expenses. She needs this loan to buy sugar, noodles, yerba and cider for the approaching end-of-year holidays.

loan.use: To buy sugar, noodles, yerba, oil, etc.

loan.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is from the village of Minaog. She is 53 years old, married and has ten adult children. Elizabeth operates a family member's business in the services sector, primarily tailoring for the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.
In 2006, Elizabeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was invested in expanding her business. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials for her tailoring. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Elizabeth from PMPC.
She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to purchase materials for tailoring

loan.name: Kabundaire United Association Group

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 31-year-old, enterprising married man with two children, living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.
He longs to set up a venture for the family that can generate sustainable income. For seven years, he has been selling fresh food. Amidst the challenges of perishable goods and high rental fees, his goal is nonetheless to supply more fresh food. He is a member of the loan group, Kabundaire United Association.
Ibrahim needs the credit facility to buy fresh food for sale.

loan.use: Buying fresh food for sale

loan.name: Mbuzi Twekambe Women's Group

texts.en:
Florence is a 24-year-old, enterprising married woman with a child living in her own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She desires to build a permanent home for the family.
For two years, she has been working in retail, enabling her to provide basics for the family. Florence needs the loan to regenerate her banana plantation. She is a member of Mbuzi Twekambe Farmers Group.

loan.use: regenerating her banana plantation

loan.name: Kirangara Group

texts.en:
Robert is single, 24 years old and hardworking. He lives in his own home in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has the zeal to work hard and save enough money.
He has been growing tomatoes and preparing nursery beds for sale. He is a member of Kirangara Group and and his desire is to own at least ten acres of tomato garden in the next two years. Robert needs the loan to buy and plant tomatoes.

loan.use: Buying land and planting tomatoes

loan.name: Elnest

texts.en:
Elnest is a 42-year-old married man with six children. He owns a home in Kasese, Uganda.
He has been selling clothes for the last two years. He started with capital of only 260,000 Uganda shillings and has grown to 900,000 Uganda shillings. His hardship is competition and his vision is having a boutique in a shopping centre plus educating his children. Elnest needs the credit facility to buy clothes to sell.

loan.use: Buying clothes for sale

loan.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 32-year-old, married man with four children, living in his own house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in tailoring business for the last fifteen years. He started with one sewing machine and now has four. His hardship is debtors who delay to pay him. His vision is to have ten machines, bigger stock and to educate his children.
John needs the loan to buy cloth material for making men's suits.

loan.use: Buy cloth materials to make men's suits

loan.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 28-year-old single man. He is from Lebanon. He works in the agriculture field, having operated a dairy product sales business for eight years. He works independently in his business and he lives on his own.
He has been practicing dairy farming since 2006. Most of his customers are people from his area. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a cow in order to increase his productivity. He is a very hard-working person. This sale will increase his working capital for his dairy business.

loan.use: to purchase a cow

loan.name: Nyabuliko Abagambakamu Group

texts.en:
Richard is a 37-year-old, married man with three children, living in a permanent home in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a member of the Nyabuliko Abagambakamu Group.
He is a retail trader and would like to become a wholesaler. He wants a loan to buy more sugar, salt and general merchandise.

loan.use: Buy more sugar, salt and general merchandise

loan.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and cooperates with his father to provide a better income for the family. He has been working as a home painter for eight years, and he has owned his business since 2007. He purchases his painting tools and products from a local painting center.
He works on a freelance basis upon request of his clients. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed painting tools. With the new utensils, he will be able to take on more projects and be in demand with his clients. In the future, he hopes to start taking on bigger projects in order to increase his business operation.

loan.use: to purchase needed painting tools

loan.name: Onondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comit Oondivepa se form con la unin de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Yataity. Todas las integrantes del comit desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, preparacin de comidas rpidas, cra de animales, etc. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compaerismo. Este comit ya estn en su tercer ciclo, todo este tiempo demostraron puntualidad, solidaridad y unin entres las compaeras. La Sra. Clementina M. es una de las integrantes de Yataity, del Barrio atiury Guasu tiene 40 aos de edad, casada, Actualmente tiene 4 Hijos, todos mayores de edad.
Ella se dedica en cras de animales como gallinas, cerdos, vacas, en su domicilio, es una seora muy trabajadora.
La Sra. con este crdito est pensando comprar Balanceados y as tener mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
The group named "Onondivepa" is made up of various neighbors in the city of Yataity. All of the members have their own businesses, including sales, fast food, raising livestock, etc.
The members of this group formed a very tight community, capable of collectively carrying out activities that will strengthen their companionship. This group is on their third loan cycle. They have always demonstrated responsibility, collegiality and team work among themselves.
Clementina M. is one of the members in Yataity, in the Natiury district. Guasu is 40 years old, she is married and she has 4 grown children.
She raises livestock, such as chickens, pigs, and cattle on her property. She is a very hardworking woman.
With this loan she will purchase feed for the livestock which will translate into better profits.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise.

loan.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and cooperates with his brother who works as a baker to cover the expenses of the family. He is also paying his young brother's school fees. He has been running a clothing store since 2004.
He opened his shop after getting the needed experience in this field almost 10 years ago. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new clothes for his shop to better serve his customers' needs. He always tries to offer new collections in his shop to attract clients and increase his sales.

loan.use: to purchase new clothes for resale

loan.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
El seor Wilfredo vive en casa propia con su seora madre en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja en transporte pblico con su micro, con el cual genera sus ingresos con los cuales cubre las necesidades de toda su familia.
El crdito que solicita es para reparar el motor de su movilidad y de esta manera mantener estable su herramienta de trabajo.
Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien; por el carcter social califica para obtener un nuevo crdito.
texts.en: Mr Wilfredo lives in his own home with his mother in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz. He works in public transportation with his minibus, with which he generates his income to cover the necessities of his entire family. The loan that he is requesting is to repair the motor of his vehicle and thus to be able to maintain his stable source of income. He is an Impro customer and repays very well. His social character qualifies him for a new loan.

loan.use: The cost of repairs for the motor of his passenger transportation vehicle.

loan.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 48-year-old widow woman. She is from Lebanon. After the death of her husband, she became the only source of income for her two children. One of her children is still attending school. So in 1997, she opened a lingerie and clothing store in her town. She has been involved in this type of business for 20 years. She obtained her first Kiva loan and she is thankful for the results. She has been a reliable client and paid on time for the duration of the loan. She was even able to complete her last payment three months earlier than her scheduled date. Today, she is requesting $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her stores inventory and, therefore, her income. Her business profit will help her provide better life conditions for her family.

loan.use: To increase her stores inventory

loan.name: ngel Ramiro

texts.es:
ngel Ramiro P. P. tiene 59 aos. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con el hijos, vive en el cantn de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolvar. Tiene 9 hijos.
Los miembros de la V.R.C SOLIDARIOS CHIMA CHICA se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantn San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos familiares, siembra maz y en pocas cantidades las papas y el frjol.
ngel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato, Quito y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los das jueves.
Solicita el crdito para la comprar de insumos agrcolas y pago a los jornaleros. Con el apoyo del crdito le ayudara econmicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueo es comprar terrenos.
Le gusta festejar las fiestas del Patrono San Miguel celebrar con amigos y familiares de la comunidad y legusta jugar ftbol y tocar la guitarra.
texts.en: ngel Ramiro P. P. is 59. He lives with his wife and children in the San Miguel canton in the Bolivar province. He has 9 children. The members of the V.R.C. SOLIDARIOS CHIMA CHICA are located 30 minutes from the San Miguel Office in the canton of San Miguel. The people of this area work in agriculture for their main source of familial income, sowing corn and small quantities of potatoes and beans. Angel works in agriculture, sowing corn and potatoes. He purchases his products in Ambato, Quito and San Miguel and sells them in the San Miguel fair on Thursdays. He is requesting the loan to purchase agricultural items and to pay the day labourers. This loan will help him to supply his necessities. They have to deal with challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to purchase lands. He likes to celebrate the festival of the Patron San Miguel with his friends and acquaintances in the community. He enjoys playing soccer and playing the guitar.

loan.use: To purchase agricultural items and pay the day workers

loan.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia vive en la zona de villa san Antonio bajo de la ciudad de La Paz. La seora, es comerciante, vende ropa, vveres y perfumes, que los distribuye en mercados, oficinas y amigos al crdito; ella cobra cada da, a la semana y al mes, dependiendo del acuerdo con su cliente. Es separada y tiene dos hijas, de 14 y 12 aos. El crdito ser destinado, para capital de trabajo (compra de Vveres, Ropa, y perfumes), para aumentar su stock de mercadera y vender ms producto. Es la primera vez que solicita un crdito en Impro, con este crdito podr mejorar su capital de trabajo, y tambin sus ingresos.
texts.en: Patricia lives in the Villa de San Antonio zone below the city of La Paz. She is a merchant and sells clothing, supplies and perfumes, which she distributes in markets, offices and to friends on credit. She charges daily, weekly and monthly depending on the agreement with her customer. She is separated and has two daughters, ages 14 and 12. This loan will be used as working capital (the purchase of supplies, clothing and perfumes) to increase her stock of merchandise and sell more products. This is the first time that she has requested a loan from Impro. With this loan, she will be able to improve her working capital and her income.

loan.use: She needs more capital to buy more clothing, supplies and perfumes to satisfy the demand of her customers.

loan.name: Lucio

texts.es:
El seor Lucio Z. Caldern es de Jejui - Chor, con casa propia, esta casado con la seora Narcisa Melgarejo Rivarola.
Es propietario de una despensa con 5 aos de funcionamiento, que es atendida por su seora, tambin habilito seccin de carnicera, el seor tiene una motocicleta en el cual realiza ventas de artculos de medicamentos, tiene clientela formada, es un seor muy trabajador y muy responsable. Gracias a los crditos que el cliente recibi de la Fundacin, su negocio esta creciendo cada da ms y esta muy agradecido por los beneficios obtenidos. Solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderias varias para su negocio especiamente bebidas y carne.
texts.en: Mr Lucio Z. Caldern is from Jejui - Chor. He has his own home and is married to Mrs Narcisa Melgarejo Rivarola. He owns a food store that has been operating for 5 years and is attended by his wife. He also has a butcher's shop. He has a motorcycle with which he sells medicinal items. He has a customer base. He is a very hard-working and responsible man. Thanks to the loans that he has received from the Fundacion, his business is growing more every day and he is very grateful for the benefits that he receives. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of various merchandise for his business, especially drinks and meat.

loan.use: The purchase of merchandise, especially drinks, meat and others

loan.name: Carmen Victoria

texts.es:
Carmen Victoria G. C. tiene 57 aos. Es viuda, vive con los hijos que son solteros, vive en el cantn de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolvar. Tiene 11 hijos.
Los miembros de la V.R.C SOLIDARIOS CHIMA CHICA se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantn San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos familiares, siembra maz y en pocas cantidades las papas y el frjol.
Carmen se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato, Quito y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los das jueves.
Solicita el crdito para la comprar de insumos agrcolas . Con el apoyo del crdito le ayudara econmicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueo es comprar terrenos para seguir sembrando y que crezca la produccin.
Le gusta festejar las fiestas del nio dios en septiembre y diciembre con la familia.
texts.en: Carmen Victoria G. C. is 57. She is a widow and lives with her unmarried children. She lives in the San Miguel canton in the province of Bolivar. She has 11 children. The members of the V.R.C SOLIDARIOS CHIMA CHICA live 30 minutes from the San Miguel Office, belonging to the San Miguel canton. This sector is devoted to agriculture as a source of household income. Here they sow corn and small quantities of potatoes and beans. Carmen works in agriculture and sows corn and potatoes. She purchases her products in Ambato, Quito and San Miguel, and sells them in the San miguel market on Thursdays. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of agricultural items. The support of this loan will help her economically to supply her necessities. They face challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to buy land to continue sowing, and for her production to increase. She likes to celebrate the holidays of the Nio Dios in September and December with her family.

loan.use: agricultural items

loan.name: Rosa Celina

texts.es:
Rosa Celina P. Y. tiene 62 aos. Es casada, vive con el esposo, vive en el cantn de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolvar. Tiene 7 hijos.
Los miembros de la V.R.C SOLIDARIOS CHIMA CHICA se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantn San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos familiares, siembra maz y en pocas cantidades las papas y el frjol.
Rosa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato, Quito y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los das jueves.
Solicita el crdito para la comprar de insumos agrcolas. Con el apoyo del crdito le ayudara econmicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueo es comprar un poco de terreno.
Le gusta salir de paseo a casa de los hijos casados y festejar las fiestas de carnaval.
texts.en:
Rosa Celina P. Y. is 62 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in San Miguel canton, in Bolvar province. She has 7 children.
The members of the SOLIDARIOS CHIMA CHICA community bank are located 30 minutes from our San Miguel office, in San Miguel canton. The members of this group work in farming. It is their source of family income. They grow corn and also, in small quantities, potatoes and beans.
Rosa grows corn and potatoes. She buys her products in Ambato, Quito and San Miguel and sells them in San Miguel market on Thursdays.
She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies. The support of this loan will help her to cover her needs financially. She faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant disease and changes in the weather. Her dream is to buy a little land.
Rosa likes to go out for a walk to visit her married children and to participate in carnival celebrations.

loan.use: Farming supplies

loan.name: Manuel Augusto

texts.es:
Manuel Augusto R. O. tiene 57 aos. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos que son solteros, vive en el cantn de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolvar. Tiene 6 hijos.
Los miembros de la V.R.C SOLIDARIOS CHIMA CHICA se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantn San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos familiares, siembra maz y en pocas cantidades las papas y el frjol.
Manuel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato, Quito y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los das jueves.
Solicita el crdito para la comprar de insumos agrcolas y pago a los jornaleros. Con el apoyo del crdito le ayudara econmicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueo es comprar un de terreno.
Le gusta criar animales y dar de comer, festejar las festividades de carnaval.
texts.en:
Manuel Augusto R. O. is 57 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children, who are single, in San Miguel canton, in Bolvar province. He has 6 children.
The members of the Solidarios Chima Chica community bank are located 30 minutes from our San Miguel office, in San Miguel canton. The members of this group work in farming. This is their source of family income. They grow corn and also, in small quantities, potatoes and beans.
Manuel grows corn and potatoes. He buys his products in Ambato, Quito and San Miguel and sells them in San Miguel market on Thursdays. He is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies and to pay day laborers. The support of this loan will help him to cover his needs financially. Manuel faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases, illnesses and changes in the weather. His dream is to buy land. He enjoys raising animals, feeding his animals and taking part in carnival celebrations.

loan.use: To buy farming supplies and pay day laborers

loan.name: Manuel Elias

texts.es:
