texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 48-year-old married man living with his wife and five young children. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a cloth tailor upon customers demands for 25 years and opened his own tailoring shop 20 years ago. His wife helps him from time to time, but he has to work hard day after day to provide better living conditions for his family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase textiles for his own use to start sewing different styles he designed. This allows him to develop his business and own a clothes store and thats what he is hoping to.

loan.use: To purchase textiles

loan.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami, who appears in the picture above, is a young man from Gaza city in Gaza Strip. Rami has graduated and was employed recently. As Rami wants to start his own business to secure a better future, he and his friend decided to start their own project with the help of FATEN.
Rami came to FATEN and took a loan to purchase part of the products that will be sold in the store. The store will specialize in home cleaning products.

loan.use: To start a small store to sell home cleaning products

loan.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As the saying goes, opportunity knocks only once. Arlene P. knows this truth and grabs every opportunity that comes her way. Arlene, 43, finished high school and is happily married to Dindo. They have been blessed with one child who is currently toddling at home. Together, they live in Pasay City, Philippines.
Arlene presently runs a food stall, where she sells packed meals for breakfast, lunch, and even dinner. Her customers are her neighbors and the local community. Having been at least 10 years in business, she knows how to pay her dues on time. She also has an excellent reputation with her fellow community partners in CCT* and, most important, her customers. Monthly, she is able to earn an average of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP).
To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP15,000 loan. She intends to use this money to purchase more raw meats, ingredients and other materials. Arlene plans to take this opportunity to drive her business towards more profitability.
Arlene's life, both business and personal, is never without challenges. Nonetheless, she stays focused on the opportunities that lie ahead, and not on the failures of yesterday or the worries of today.
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loan.use: to buy raw meats, condiments, vegetables and other ingredients

loan.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua O. is divorced. She has been producing and selling Fante kenkey in Abura for six years. Ekua uses her income to see to the well-being of her home. She will use this loan to expand her business by purchasing additional bags of maize for the preparation of kenkey. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to build a house.

In this photograph, Ekua is in the process of wrapping the dough to be cooked. In her left-hand (in a pan) are some cooked Fante kenkey.

loan.use: to purchase more maize for the preparation of kenkey

loan.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is a 34-year-old married man with three children. Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money and has gained knowledge of business record keeping. These skills have helped him run his Jes Engineering business for seven years, selling motor vehicle spare parts. He hopes to fully establish his business in the future. He plans to use this 50,000 KES loan to buy a valve grinding machine.

loan.use: to buy a valve grinding machine

loan.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa A. K. sells cooked rice in Abura. She has attained a senior high level of education. She is married and lives with her husband and two children. She assists her husband in feeding and clothing her family. Her loan will be used to buy bags of rice and others ingredients to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loan.use: to buy bags of rice and other ingredients

loan.name: Boldoo

texts.en:
Boldoo G., 51 years old, lives with his wife and three children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent and fence, in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. Two of his children attend a local secondary school and his oldest son works as a repairer in a local company. His wife cooks meals in her home and delivers them all over town to markets and office buildings.

Boldoo operates a welding service and iron/metal business out of his fence, producing items such as stoves, stove pipes, doors, etc. He began his business in 2001 and has gained a lot of experience as an ironsmith. Boldoo says, "I want my children to go to university and be well educated. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan; he will use half of it to pay his children's tuition fees and the other half to purchase raw materials for making a variety of steel products.

loan.use: to purchase raw materials and to pay his children's tuition fees

loan.name: Gerard

texts.en:
Gerard D. is from the town of Banga. He is 32 years old, married and has a 5-year-old child. Gerard owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Gerard works hard to provide for the increasing needs of his household.
Gerard joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Gerard is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers.

loan.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers

loan.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua B. is a single parent taking care of four children. She has attained junior high level education. Ekua cooks banku (a local dish made from corn dough and served hot with soup) for sale in Abura. Ekua uses her income to see to the well-being of her home. Ekua will use this loan to purchase more maize to cook and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to reinvest in her business. In this photograph, Ekua is showing the maize used to cook the banku.

loan.use: to purchase more maize to cook

loan.name: Duong's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of five low-income people who live together in Siem Reap Province. Duong R., 62, has been selected as a leader of the group. Duong R. is a married woman and the mother of seven children. Five of them are married and work at different occupations. Duong R. lives with her 61-year-old husband. They have been fishermen since 2000, earning approximately US$6.00 per day to use for daily expenses for their family. The family living conditions are not good because their house is old and falling down. Because of this problem, Duong R. is looking for a loan to repair her old house.
There are four-member group who will jointly repay the Kiva loan. Mrs. S., 37, is a clothes seller who is asking for a loan to sustain her business growth. Mr. S., 27, is a fisherman who is requesting a loan to buy more fishing tools. Mrs. C. has a job as a fish catcher. She needs a loan to buy nets for her fishing business. Mr. K. is a vegetable seller who is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables for selling.

loan.use: To repair her old house.

loan.name: Buyanhishig

texts.en: Buyanhishig E., 52 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence. His youngest daughter attends a local high school and his wife is retired. Buyanhishig operates a construction business specializing in interior and exterior decoration of buildings. Buyanhishig has owned this business for almost 20 years and over this long time he has gained a lot of experience. For the future, he plans to build his own house. He is a hardworking man and is requesting this 800,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary materials and supplies for his construction decoration business.

loan.use: to purchase necessary materials and supplies

loan.name: Munther

texts.en:
Munther is a 29-year-old man from Gaza City in Gaza Strip. Munther is married and has one daughter, Amal, who is five years old and one son, Rami, who is four years old.
Munther is a National Palestinian Authority employee and, as he is a government employees, his salary is not enough and he has to think of another source of income. Munther's father has a taxi that he doesn't use anymore therefor he decided to fix it and start use it to secure another source of income. Munther took a loan to replace the taxi's engine.
Munther appears in the picture here next to the taxi.
About this loan product: FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loan.use: To purchase a car engine

loan.name: James

texts.en: James is a married man with four children aged 23, 21, 20 and 10. He has been operating a taxi business for seven years. He has does poultry farming for a living. He dreams of owning more cars for his taxi business. He has requested a first loan of 50,000 KES to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loan.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed

loan.name: Maksim

texts.en: Maksim D., 58 years old, lives with his wife and two sons in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence. His youngest son, 21, attends university, his other son is disabled and his wife is retired and stays at home with the son. Maksim operates a taxi service. He began his business in 2008 and has gained much experience over this short period. He has found success with his transportation business and his earnings have enabled him to buy a car and pay off half of it. Maksim is a modest person and says, "I plan to drive my current car for 2 years and after that, I'll change it for a bigger truck for the future." He is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan in order to pay down the last half owing on his car.

loan.use: to pay the remaining money owing on his car

loan.name: Ama Demawu

texts.fr: Ama a 28 ans et est marie. Elle a 2 enfants en charge. Elle est ne Agou et habite quartier Adidogom. Elle a 2 enfants et exerce comme activit gnratrice de revenus la vente de cartes de recharges. En effet, elle a commenc cette activit en 2005 et sapprovisionne Togo cellulaire, Togotlcom et Moov. A travers cette activit elle a rembours deja plusieurs credits. Elle revend ensuite son domicile. Elle demande un prt pour acheter 80 cartes Togocel, 75 cartes illico et 40 cartes Moov.
texts.en:
Ama is 28 years old, married, and the mother of two children in her care. She was born in Agou and now lives in the neighborhood of Adidogom.
She makes a living selling mobile phone recharge cards, a business she started in 2005. She gets her stock from Togocel, Togotelecom and Moov, and then sells the cards from her home.
She has already managed to repay several loans through this activity. She is now seeking a loan to purchase 80 Togocel cards, 75 Illico cards and 40 Moov cards.

loan.use: To purchase mobile phone recharge cards

loan.name: Buyannemeh

texts.en:
Buyannemeh T., 41 years old, lives with her husband and three children in the Uvs province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent and fence. Her oldest two children both attend a vocational training school and her youngest son attends a local high school. Her husband operates a taxi service and earns monthly revenues of 100,000 and 150,000 MNT.

Buyannemeh operates a shoemaking business. She sews a variety of traditional Mongolian shoes according to her customer's orders. She started her business in 2006 and has since gained much experience as a shoemaker. Over the years, she has managed to establish her business as a stable operation and her working capital now exceeds 900,000 MNT. Buyannemeh is a modest and hardworking person and is requesting a 1,100,000 MNT loan to purchase materials and supplies for making 32 pair of traditional shoes.

loan.use: to purchase materials and supplies

loan.name: Siem's Group

texts.en:
Siem S., 36, has been selected to be group leader by the members. He has two children who are studying at the secondary school. He earns a living by driving a motorcycle taxi and also works as a requirement laborer. He is married to Kean Sam, 35, who works selling a few groceries from home. Recently Siem S. feels upset; he cant earn much income because his motor taxi often is broken and is not attractive to the customers. To resolve the problem, Siem S. decided to seek a loan to replace his broken motorbike.
The other four member of the group are: Mr. H. is a taxi (Tuk Tuk) driver who requests a loan to replace his old taxi. Mrs. H. is a grocery seller who is applying for a loan to buy some grocery items for selling. Mrs. K. is a single lady selling groceries to earn a living. She needs a loan to accumulate more grocery items. Mr. S. is a motor taxi driver. He will use his loan for his wife to buy additional cooking ingredients for food selling.

loan.use: To buy a used motorbike.

loan.name: Milka

texts.en: Milka is a 50-year-old married woman who is blessed with six children. She runs a cafeteria to earn a living. She has been operating the business for three years with four employees. She also depends on her husband for financial support. She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy cooking oil, a microwave, a television and a water dispenser.

loan.use: to buy cooking oil, a microwave, a television and a water dispenser

loan.name: Raphael Ndirangu

texts.en:
Raphael Ndirangu has been operating a retail shop in Kiwanja, Thika Road Town, for six years with a maximum monthly profit of Kshs. 10,000. He is 29 years old, single and a hard working gentleman.
He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend, and he has a very good credit history with the firm. Raphael is applying for his fourth loan of Kshs. 50,000 from KADET after repaying the previous loans well and in good time. He will use the loan to purchase more stock of goods for the retail shop to sell during the high season.
The anticipated profit he plans to plough back into the business for it to grow, and he hopes that the business will be stable financially. In the future he hopes to venture into the transport industry.

loan.use: To purchase more stock for the retail shop.

loan.name: Gungaabuu

texts.en: Gungaabuu U., 35 years old, lives with his wife and four children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. The family lives together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in his brother's enclosure. All of his four children attend a local school and his wife is currently unemployed. Gungaabuu supports his entire family by operating a taxi service in his town. At first, he started a coal and firewood sales business in 2006 and stopped in 2009 due to bad sales. Since May 2010, he has been managing a taxi service after purchasing a car. For the future, he hopes to buy his own enclosure and grocery shop. He is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary tools and parts, such as 4 tires, for his car.

loan.use: to purchase necessary tools and parts, such as 4 tires

loan.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua O. is 30 years old and married with two children, both aged 3 years old, whom they hope to educate to the university level. His business is located among many other businesses beside a highway in the Kisumu region of Kenya, known as the lake region since it harbors the famous Lake Victoria. Joshua's business is well known as Kandong'a and Sons Enterprises. He makes and sells such items as saucepans, trays and cookers to the local people. He has been operating this business for 8 years and has three employees. He says that this business is profitable and his major challenge is financial constraints. He is using this loan of KES 40,000 to buy scrap metal to make more items to sell as Christmas festivities approach. He hopes to be a big manufacturer of metal products. He describes himself as goal oriented, determined and ambitious.

loan.use: to buy scrap metal

loan.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene is 30 years old and is married with two children between 4 and 10 years old. He owns a small bar and has been in this business for about five years. The hours of his business are from 7 am until 9 pm every day.
Eugene has requested a loan to purchase a large quantity of foodstuffs such as rice and sugar. Any profits he makes will be used for further reinvestment and to build a secure future for his family.

loan.use: To purchase foodstuffs like rice and sugar.

loan.name: Darisuren

texts.en: Darisuren E., 47 years old, lives with her husband and children in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband works as an inspector at the local power station and her son attends university. Darisuren operates a meat and livestock trading business in her town. She started her business in 2000 and has since gained a lot of experience as a businesswoman. Her business currently operates at a stable level and she continues to make progress. Her business earnings have enabled her to buy a car in order to transport her products. She travels through the countryside to buy her meat and livestock and transports them to her town to sell as a retailer. For the future, she plans to buy a larger truck as a result of high transportation costs. Darisuren is a talkative and helpful person and says, "I want to improve my house and enclosure by next year." She is requesting a 2,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat and livestock from the countryside.

loan.use: to purchase more meat and livestock

loan.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a businesswoman who makes a living operating a retail shop. Her business has done well, and she has made good use of loans from Faulu Kenya to save money and hire one employee. Her goal is to provide her children with a quality education, and she has applied for this loan for 50,000 Kes to improve her productivity by buying a motorbike.

loan.use: To buy a motorbike

loan.name: Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Bernard is 31 years old and is single. Bernard is the leader of a group which is called 'Abishyizehamwe' which means in English 'being together'. This group contains five people: one woman and four men.
Bernard owns a small shop which sells different kinds of products. His wife is in the government and they both work hard for their family. Bernard has experience in his business of one year, and his business is open from 7 am until 9 pm and employs 3 people.
Bernard has requested a loan from Kiva via Vision Finance Company to purchase more merchandise to sell. He plans to use any profits to buy his own house.

loan.use: Expanding business.

loan.name: Seab

texts.en:
Selling pieces of wood is the most important part of 26 year old Seab S.s daily work. Her husband can earn a profit by driving a boat to pick up people who need to cross the river. Seab S. and her husband support their two children who are studying in public school. This family can make an average income of $8 per day for spending on the whole family.
Currently, Seab S. wishes to expand her sales business, but she lacks the funds to make it possible. So, she would like a loan to purchase additional pieces of wood to sell in order to make extra revenue.

loan.use: To purchase additional pieces of wood for selling.

loan.name: Batbold

texts.en: Batbold M. is 33 years old and lives with his wife and six-year old son in an apartment in Arhangai province in Mongolia. Batbold is a carpenter who produces a variety of wooden items, working from his home to fill orders. He has been in this business for six years, and has earned the loyalty of his customers because of the quality of his work and his outstanding service. He has been able to expand his business and hopes to establish and run a factory in the future. He is applying for this loan for 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy more timber for his business.

loan.use: To buy more timber

loan.name: Gratien

texts.en:
Gratien is 30 years old and is married with two children who are 3 and 4 years old. Gratien is a motorbike driver. This business of transportation is very profitable for him and he has experience in this business of about four years. The hours of his business are from 6 am until 8 pm every day.
Gratien has requested a loan in order to buy a new motorbike. This new motorbike will help him to attract more customers, simply because the clients normally choose the one who has the new motorbike.
With this loan, Gratien expects to earn more profits from his transportation service. He hopes to use this profit to build his future and to pay school fees for his children.

loan.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loan.name: Purevdulam

texts.en: Purevdulam D. is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in their own house in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her older daughter attends kindergarten and her youngest daughter stays at home. Purevdulam makes a living operating a coal and firewood trading business, and does her selling the local market. She has been in this business since 2002 and has gained a lot of experience from her work. In the future, she plans to start her own coal and firewood trading market. Purevdulam is a modest and honest person who is applying for a loan for 2,000,000 MNT to buy more coal and firewood to sell during the upcoming winter months, when prices are high.

loan.use: To buy more coal and firewood to sell to her customers

loan.name: Tharcissie

texts.en:
Tharcissie is 37 years old and is married with five children aged between 1 and 11 years old. Tharcissie sells cassava. She has been in this business for about four years and employs two people. Her business hours are from 6 am until 7 pm every day.
Tharcissie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by adding a variety of cassava. Any profits she makes she will use to buy her own boutique and purchase different products.

loan.use: To purchase more cassava to sell.

loan.name: Marie Solange

texts.en:
Marie Solange is 31 years old and is married. She has three children who are 6 and 10 years old. Marie Solange is a proven entrepreneur who sells vegetables in her village. She has been in this business for about 10 years and her store is open from 6 am until 9 pm every day except on Sunday.
Marie Solange has requested a Kiva loan that will allow her to buy more vegetables and upgrade her facilities. She would like to save any profit that she makes.

loan.use: To buy vegetables to sell.

loan.name: Erhbayar

texts.en: Erhbayar B. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a rented apartment in the Songinohairhan section of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His daughter is in a kindergarten. He used to operate a coal-trading business but left it to go into business selling clothes at the Narantuul market, which is largest in the city. Last year, he opened a new business selling bicycles and quickly built up a stable and successful operation. His current goal is to expand his bicycle business and one day open his own trading center. He is a modest, honest man and is applying for a loan for 1,100,000 MNT to buy and assemble more bicycles.

loan.use: To buy and assemble more bicycles for sale

loan.name: Mark

texts.en: Mark is 30 years old, married and blessed with four children. He makes a living operating a boda boda or motorbike transport business. Thanks to help from Faulu Kenya, he has been able to secure a loan and buy a motorbike. To earn additional income, he also operates a cafeteria where his customers are people who live nearby. He has applied for a new loan to buy items he needs for the cafeteria, including wheat flour, baking powder, cooking oil and sugar.

loan.use: To buy items he needs for a cafeteria, including wheat flour, baking powder, cooking oil and sugar.

loan.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is 45 years old and is married with two children between the ages of 16 and 20 years old. Speciose is well known for her business of selling a variety of goods, like tomatoes, soap, toothpaste, etc. as shown in her photo. This is her tenth successful year in business and she works from 8 am until 6 pm every day.
Speciose has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her shop by purchasing a large quantity of foodstuffs, mainly rice, peas, beans, wheat, etc. With this additional business, Speciose hopes that she will earn more profits to help her family. She would like to keep reinvesting for better progress in her business.

loan.use: To buy rice, beans, wheat and other foodstuffs.

loan.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla a 36 ans et est marie. Elle a un enfant en charge. Pour pouvoir participer au mnage, elle exerce comme activit la restauration plus prcisment la vente de la viande de port et dbit de boissons. Dans cette activit, elle cumule 2 ans dj et sapprovisionne Nop pour acqurir les porcs et les ingrdients au grand march de Lom. Ensuite elle satisfait les clients dans un restaurant Adidogom non loin de lcole ANNE ALBERT. Elle demande un crdit pour pouvoir se rapprovisionner.
texts.en: Abla is 36. She is married and has one child at home. To help out with household expenses, she operates a restaurant selling pork dishes and drinks. She has been doing this for two years. She buys meat at Nop, and other ingredients in the big marketplace in Lom. Her restaurant is in Adidogom, not far from the Anne Albert school. She is asking for a loan to build her inventory.

loan.use: Buy pork and drinks

loan.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is 25 years old and is married with 2 children aged between 3 and 5. Juliennes husband is a driver, while she owns a general store, a business she has been running for 5 years.
Julienne has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more products for her shop. This loan will help her to obtain more profits from her sales. With extra profits, Julienne hopes to pay school fees for her children and save money for the future.

loan.use: Expanding her business.

loan.name: Munhtuya

texts.en:
Munhtuya N. is young lady who lives on her own with her sibling. Her parents own 200 livestock and live as a herders in the countryside in Uvs province in western Mongolia. Her sibling attends a college, majoring in carpentry.
Munhtuya operates a hair salon in a rented room of an apartment with the help of her aunt. She started to work as a hairdresser in 2009 after graduating from Ulaangom college as a hairdresser. She and her aunt recently opened their salon in a rented space and therefore they need to remodel and decorate to their workplace. For the future, she hopes to have her own hair salon.
Munhtuya is hardworking woman and says, "In order to open (a) big, professional hair salon, I need to work very hard at least five to six years." She is requesting a 300,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase necessary equipment and tools for her hair salon.

loan.use: To purchase necessary equipment and tools

loan.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 27 years old and is married with two children between 1 and 3 years old. Jean Baptiste has been a motorbike taxi driver for three years. He gets up at 5 am and works until 10 pm every day to transport people around the city.
Jean Baptiste has requested a loan worth 500,000 Rwf to buy his own motorbike taxi. His goal is to buy a house for the family.

loan.use: To buy a motorbike.

loan.name: Iye Bah

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Iye Bah C.. She is married and has two children, ages 6 and 9.
In 2000, Iye Bah established her food (eggs, oil and milk) business. She began her business because she hoped to be self-employed and earn a profit to help her family. Working six days a week and six hours a day, Iye Bah earns about 350,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business.
She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 in order to increase her business and profits. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Iye Bah plans to educate her children, buy additional goods for larger stock and open a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loan.use: Purchase more food

loan.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Akouavi a 32 ans. Elle est coiffeuse de profession mais associe la vente de produits de beaut et des mches. Elle cumule 10 ans dans cette activit et sapprovisionne au grand march de Lom. Avec cette activit, elle a rembours plusieurs crdits dj. Elle demande un prt pour satisfaire plus de clients. La dame est entrain de coiffer une cliente.
texts.en: Akouavi is 32. She is a trained hairdresser, and also sells beauty products and hairpieces. She has been doing this for ten years. She buys her supplies in the big marketplace in Lom. She has already repaid several loans, and is asking for another loan to be able to cope with more customers. In the picture, she is styling a customer's hair.

loan.use: Buy beauty products and hairpieces

loan.name: Thacienne

texts.en:
Thacienne is 37 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 4 and 8 years old. Thacienne is a proven entrepreneur who sells food in her village. She has been in this business for about 4 years. The hours of her business are from 7 am until 8 pm every day.
Thacienne has requested a Kiva loan that will allow her to increase her sales, as well as her profits. With this loan, she hopes to start selling various fruits, vegetables, and cooking oil because they are popular items. With this additional business, which hopefully will attract many customers, Thacienne will keep expanding her business with a vision of being financially stable.

loan.use: To purchase fruit and other food to sell.

loan.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 42 years old and she is married with six children. She has owned her small general store for about five years. The hours of her business are from 6 am until 8.30 pm every day.
Catherine has now requested a Kiva loan so that she can expand her shop by adding enough cosmetics and foodstuffs like sugar, rice and different types of flour, and some other goods which seem to be in high demand in her business area. Catherine plans to start saving as well as improve her family's situation with any profits that she earns.

loan.use: To buy more products to sell.

loan.name: Dieu Donne

texts.en:
Dieu Donne is 32 years old and is single. Dieu Donne is a self-employed businessman selling a variety of traditional art and handicrafts, which he has been doing for 2 years. His shop is open from 8 am until 8 pm every day and he employs two people.
Dieu Donne has now requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing a large quantity of art and handicrafts as they are high in demand. With this large quantity he will also start wholesaling. In doing so, Dieu Donne hopes to earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to renovate his house and save for secure future.

loan.use: To purchase more handicrafts to sell.

loan.name: Rakiatou

texts.fr: RAkiatou a 45 ans et est marie mdecin. Elle est mre de 3 enfants. Elle fait le commerce de pagnes et bijoux et compte 13 ans dans cette activit. Elle sapprovisionne au grand march de Lom et revend ensuite ct du march Ago. Elle sollicite un prt pour acqurir 10 pices de pagnes BT, 10 pices de pagnes Bazins et 10 pices de pagnes phoenis et 20 paquets de chaines.
texts.en: Rakiatou is 45. She is married to a doctor, and has three children. For 13 years, she has been selling traditional cloth and jewelry. She buys her stock in the big marketplace in Lom et sells it in the Ago marketplace. She is asking for a loan to buy 30 lengths of wax cloth (10 BT brand, 10 Bazin brand and 10 Phoenix brand) and 20 packs of jewelry chains.

loan.use: Buy cloth and jewelry

loan.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 30 years old and is married with two children who are 2 and 4 years old. He owns a shop selling a variety of goods. He has owned this shop for about three years and the hours of his business are from 6 am until 10 pm every day. He currently employs two people.
Innocent has now requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a large quantity of goods to sell. He hopes that, through those additional goods, he will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will allow him to keep reinvesting and start saving for a better future.

loan.use: To buy rice, flour, sugar, and other foods to sell.

loan.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 53 years old and is a widow. She is a proven entrepreneur who sells food in her village. She has been in this business for about 12 years and works from 8 am until 8 pm every day.
Chantal has requested a Kiva loan that will allow her to increase her sales, as well as her profits. With this loan, she hopes to start selling various fruits, vegetables, cooking oil, and onions because they are often purchased in her business area. With this additional business, which hopefully will attract many customers, Chantal will keep expanding her business with a vision of being financially stable.

loan.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loan.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Seor Juan P. es cliente recurrente de la Fundacin Paraguaya, se inicio en el ao 2008, est casado con la Seora Ramona Benitez con quien tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, poseen una despensa en su domicilio que est ubicado en la comunidad de Potrero Yvate. El desea contar para estas fiesta con todos las mercaderias de cosumo masivo por la fiestas que llegan y para ello solicita el prestamo para la compra de bebidas, verduras, panificados, carne y otros.
Todos los crditos retirados por el mencionado poseen un histrico impecable de pago, agradece el crecimiento laboral que obtuvo con nuestra Institucin.
texts.en:
Juan P. is a recurring client of Fundacin Paraguaya, having started working with the institution in 2008. He is married to Ramona Benitez with whom he has three grown-up children. They own a small grocery store in their home which is located in the community of Potrero Yvate.
This festive season, Juan P. would like to be able to offer popular merchandise for the holiday period in his store. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy drinks, vegetables, baked goods, meat, etc.
All the loans Juan P. has taken out have had an impeccable payment history. He is grateful for the growth he has been able to achieve in his business with our institution's help.

loan.use: To buy drinks, baked goods, meat, etc.

loan.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 40 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 1 month and 16 years old. Jean takes care of two other dependents.
Jean works as a motorbike taxi driver and this is his fourth year in his business. He gets up at 5 a.m. every day and works until 8 p.m.
Jean has requested a loan to buy his own motorbike taxi. With the profits from this loan, he will save for the future, pay school fees and be able to build his own house for the family.

loan.use: To buy another motorbike

loan.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora B. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 58 years old. Adora is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Adora owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Adora has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP every four months.

In 2007, Adora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase breeding livestock. Adora is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Adora from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loan.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loan.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena M. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 50 years old. Elena is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Elena owns and operates a business running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Elena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Elena is requesting a new loan of 28,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Elena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loan.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loan.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex L. is from the village of Rizal West San Isidro. He is 46 years old. Alex is single. To make a living, Alex owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chicken for sale. Alex has been engaged in his business for more than two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alex joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alex has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Alex is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Alex from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loan.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loan.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon L. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 54 years old. Corazon is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Corazon owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Corazon has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP every four months.

In 2010, Corazon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Corazon from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loan.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loan.name: Dukore Group

texts.en:
Sadiki is the group leader of five members, each with a different business. Sadiki is 43 years old and is married with one child who is one year old.
Sadiki works as a photographer. The hours of his business are from 7 am until 9 pm and this is his 4th successful year.
Sadiki is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more equipment for his photography business. Sadiki would like to earn more profits which will help him to save money for his children and to build a house.

loan.use: To purchase more photography equipment.

loan.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy A. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City,. She is 44 years old. Daisy is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Daisy owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Daisy has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP every four months.

In 2006, Daisy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Daisy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loan.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loan.name: Abdibait

texts.en:
Abdibait N. was born in the Republic of Tadjikistan, in a large family of farmers. From early childhood he had to help his parents in the field where his family cultivated vegetables. After graduating from Pedagogical University with diploma with honors, Abdibait returned home and began to work as a teacher of Russian language and literature at the local school. He was 26 years old, when he married and moved to Kyrgystan.
Using the money he had earned, Abdibait bought a house and rented land for cultivating crops. With the revenues from this activity, he bought a crushing machine and started his business of producing combined feed. He sells his products at the local market and supplies his loyal customers in neighbouring villages. In order to broaden his business and purchase crops for planting, he obtained his first loan from Bai Tushum, which was repaid without any delays.
Abdibait plans to use this loan of 80,000 Kyrgyz Soms to purchase 10 tonnes of barley and 4 tonnes of corn. It will allow him to resell combined feed from these products in winter at higher prices. In the future, Abdibait is planning to give a higher education to his children and build a house for his family. Being a very purposeful and positive person, Abdibait works hard to support his family.
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loan.use: To purchase crops.

loan.name: Madres Unidas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se form a travs de la Sra. Beata, les invito a sus vecinas para conformar un comit. Todas las integrantes del comit desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, cras de animales, etc. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compaerismo. Este comit ya estn en su tercer ciclo, todo este tiempo demostraron puntualidad, solidaridad y unin entres las compaeras. Una de la integrantes es la seora Gregoria F. quien se dedica a la cra y venta de animales menores como gallinas, patos, cerdos y otros. Ella los cras y en el momento de alguna de necesidad que tiene la familia vende sus animales para contar con los medios econmicos que necesitan. Se encuentra muy contenta con el grupo y solicita el prstamo para la compra de tejidos ya que desea construir porquerizas y gallineros con mejores instalaciones para sus animales.
texts.en:
This Group was founded by Ms. Beata who invited her neighbors to form a committee. All of the members of the committee are engaged in independent businesses such as sales, raising animals, etc. The members are a very united group who participate in joint activities that strengthen their camaraderie. This committee is already in their third loan cycle and, throughout this time, they have shown punctuality, solidarity, and union among the partners.
One of the members is Ms. Gregoria F. who raises and sells small animals such as chickens, ducks, pigs, and others. When the need arises, she sells them in order to raise money to support her family. She is very happy with the group and is requesting this loan to buy material as she wishes to build pigpens and henhouses with better accommodations for her animals.

loan.use: To purchase materials.

loan.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is 33 years old and married. She has been running a kindergarten so as to earn a living. In the school, she has employed three people. The school is located in the church compound; hence, most of the pupils are members of the church. She opened the school four years ago and she has seen growth in the number of students. Her dream is to expand the school into a primary school in the future. She has requested for a loan of 40,000 KES to buy books, furniture and for building a classroom.

loan.use: To buy books, furniture and for building a classroom.

loan.name: Kariuki

texts.en: Kariuki is a member of Faulu Kenya under Bidii Daima group. He joined the group of young entrepreneurs so as to share business ideas, save his money and to get loans from Faulu Kenya easily. Since he joined the group, he has been able to expand his business, which is selling charcoal. He was previously selling newspapers for a living before he started selling charcoal. He has requested for 40,000 KES to add stock of charcoal.

loan.use: To add stock of charcoal

loan.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 26 years old and she is married with 4 children aged between 2 weeks and 7 years old. Jacqueline sells a local traditional beer in the Nyagahinga district in Rwanda. She has been in this business for about 5 years. The hours of her small bar are from 6 am to 6 pm every day except on Saturdays. She currently employs 4 people in her business.
Jacqueline will use this loan to buy more sorghum for making local traditional beer. With this loan, Jacqueline hopes also to improve the quality of service in her bar. If it is completely successful, Jacqueline will start saving for her future.

loan.use: To buy more sorghum to make traditional beer.

loan.name: Asoc.de Mujeres Ama De Casa Group

texts.es: El comit Asoc.ama de casa se form con la unin de varias vecinas de Capiibary-4 de Mayo. Todas las integrantes del comit desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, Despensa, cra de animales. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compaerismo y al adquirir el crdito se le abren muchas puertas Para el progreso de sus emprendimiento. Margarita T. de Quionez es la Presidenta del grupo es una seora muy emprendedora, le gusta la organizacin por eso se le eligieron como cabeza de grupo. Ella posee una despensa y cras de animales (como chancho, gallinas etc. Tiene 52 aos con dos hijos. Todos mayores de edad. Solicita el prstamo para la compra de alimento para los animales.
texts.en:
The group named "Asoc. Ama de Casa" is made up of several neighbors who live in Capibary, 4 de Mayo. Each of the members of the group carries out their own business, including sales, convenience store, and livestock farming.
The members came together and formed a much unified group that is capable of carrying out activities that support their common goals, especially in the acquisition of loans. Loans have opened many doors and with this help they have seen progress in their businesses.
Margarita T. de Quinonez is the leader of the group and she is a very enterprising person. She enjoys organizing which is the reason why she was chosen to be the leader of the group.
She has a convenience store and she also raises livestock (including pigs, chickens, etc). She is 52 years old and she has 2 grown children. She requests a loan to purchase feed for her livestock.

loan.use: To purchase livestock feed.

loan.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 34 years old and is married with three children who are between 8 and 13 years old. She sells beauty and other cosmetic products. Beatrice has been in this business for about three years and her store is open from 6 am to 9 pm every day.
Vestine will use this loan to expand her business by adding more products such as rice, sugar, salt, etc . Any profits made from the use of this loan will be reinvested in her business to help it continue to do well.

loan.use: To purchase more cosmetic and beauty products to sell.

loan.name: Adidas

texts.en:
Adidas is 32 years old and is married. She sells beans. Adidas has been in this business for about four years and her store is open from 7am to 4pm every day except on Sunday, and she currently employs two people.

Adidas will use this loan to expand her business by adding more beans. Any profits made from the use of this loan will be reinvested in her business.

She thanks you for your support!

loan.use: To purchase more beans to sell.

loan.name: Marie Louise

texts.en:
Marie Louise is 35 years old and is a widow with two children, ages 8 and 9 years old. Marie Louise sells cassava. She has been in this business for about two years and the hours of her business are from 6am to 6pm every day except on Saturday. She currently employs two people.

Marie Louise will use this loan to buy more cassava to sell. Any profits she makes will allow her to reinvest. In addition, she will start to save for the future.

loan.use: To buy more cassava

loan.name: Felicien

texts.en:
Felicien is 22 years old and is still single. He has three years of experience in the business of selling goods in his shop. His shop includes a variety of goods such as soap, toilette papers, lotion, sugar, etc., and is open from 6am to 8pm every day except on Sunday. He currently employs two people in his business.

Felicien will use this loan to purchase a variety of products, mainly rice, sugar, beans, soap etc. Felicien will use any profits to start saving for further reinvestment in his business and plans to buy a house.

loan.use: To purchase foodstuffs for a general store

loan.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a 31-year-old married man who is blessed with two children who attend school. For four years, Antony has been selling charcoal. Previously, he earned a living from farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Antony has learned how to manage his finances which is helping him to run his business well.
Antony is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy charcoal. In the future, he dreams of expanding his business to the wholesale market.

loan.use: to buy charcoal

loan.name: Felicien

texts.en:
Felicien is 31 years old and single. He has three years of experience in tailoring and selling handmade clothes. Felicien makes different types of clothing including clothes for wedding ceremony rentals. His business is open daily from seven in the morning through nine at night.
Feliciens loan will help him to buy different colors and quantities of cloth and thread to boost sales and maximize profit. The loan he requested via Vision Finance Company will improve his well-being. In the future, Felicien has plans to build a house.

loan.use: to buy different colors and quantities of cloth and thread

loan.name: Happiness Group

texts.es: El comit La Alegra se form con la unin de varias vecinas de Capibary. Todas las integrantes del comit desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, Despensa,cria de animales. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compaerismo y al adquirir el crdito se le abren muchas puertas Para el progreso de sus emprendimientos La Sra. Lis es una de las integrantes del comit, ella posee una despensa y cras de animales. En fin realiza varias actividades, es una seora muy creativa en su actividad, y todos sus clientes quedan muy admirados con sus trabajos. Ella tiene una familia muy unida con tres Hijos. Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo. La seora solicita el crdito para la compra de balanceados etc.
texts.en:
The group named "La Alegria", meaning "Happiness", is made up of several neighbors who live in Capibary. Each of the members of the group carries out their own business, including sales, convenience store, and livestock farming.
The members came together to form a much unified group that is capable of carrying out activities that support their common goals, especially in the acquisition of loans. Loans have opened many doors and with this help they have seen progress in their businesses.
Lis is a member of the group. She has a convenience store and she also raises livestock. She is a busy businesswoman, being a very creative individual in her work. All of her clients are impressed with her work.
She has a very close family, with three children. She is very happy with her business and with the loans that her group receives. She requests a loan to purchase livestock feed, etc.

loan.use: To purchase livestock feed.

loan.name: Sylverien

texts.en:
Sylverien is 37 years old and married with three children between the ages of two and 12. He is a moto-taxi driver and has been in this business for about seven years. Sylveriens working hours are from 5:30am to 6:30pm every day.
Sylverien will use this loan to buy a second motorcycle. Any profits he makes will allow him to start a second business selling cassava. Sylverien hopes to save for the future and invest in his cassava business.

loan.use: to buy a motorcycle

loan.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
En la zona Nororiental de Medelln-Colombia, situado en terrenos de moderadas y altas pendientes, se encuentra ubicado el barrio Manrique La Cruz, conformado por familias campesinas que llegaron a la ciudad, a causa del desplazamiento al que se vieron sometidas. Y es all donde se encuentra la microempresa de Luz Mery P. D. quien desde hace dos aos decidi hacer de la tradicional arepa su sustento familiar.
Las arepas de Luz Mery son hechas al carbn lo que le da mejor sabor y hace que sus clientes las prefieran. Estar en pie desde las 5:00 a.m. para iniciar las ventas y soportar el calor que genera el asador y que le produce dolor en sus manos no ha sido impedimento para salir adelante y continuar con su negocio.
Como emprendedora y gran visionaria, Luz Mery, suea con ampliar su negocio hasta tener un restaurante reconocido en el barrio y as mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The Manrique La Cruz neighborhood is located in the northeast area of Medellin-Colombia. It is situated among even fields and high slopes. The neighborhood is comprised of country people who came to the city because of the forced displacement they were subjected to.
This is where the small businesswoman, Luz Mery P. D., can be found. Two years ago she decided to make the traditional arepa (flat bread served with various fillings or toppings) to support her family.
Luz Mery cooks the arepas over charcoal. This gives them better flavor and her customers prefer her arepas. She is on her feet starting at 5:00 a.m. in order to begin the sales and to bear the heat generated from the roaster. This causes pain in her hands, but it has not been an impediment to getting ahead and continuing with her business.
As an entrepreneur and a great visionary, Luz Mery dreams of expanding her business until she has a well-known neighborhood restaurant. That way she will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loan.use: Adaptation of the business and to buy ingredients

loan.name: Kossi Sna

texts.fr: Kossi est g de 23 ans. Il gre comme activit gnratrice de revenus, la vente des produits dalimentations gnrale. En effet, il a commenc en 2004 cette activit et sapprovisionne au grand march de Lom. Ensuite, il revend ses produits son domicile Franciscain. Il est aid par 3 employs dans ses activits. Avec ce nouveau crdit, il espre acheter 3 bidons dhuile, 5 sacs de riz, 4 sacs de sucres et 2 cartons de tomates.
texts.en:
Kossi is 23 years old. As an income-producing activity, he sells general food products. He began in 2004 and obtains his supplies at the grand market in Lom. Then, he re-sells the products at his home in Franciscain. 3 employees help him.
With this new loan, he hopes to buy 3 barrels of oil, 5 sacks of rice, 4 sacks of sugar and 2 boxes of tomatoes.

loan.use: To buy food products

loan.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is 34 years old. She is married with two children between 6 months and 3 years old. Solange has a small retail store selling a wide variety of goods. She has been in this business for two years and the hours of her business are from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. She currently employs one person.
Solange will use this loan to purchase different goods to sell, such as bread, juice, lotion, fruits, etc. Any profits she makes will allow her to continue taking care of her children. In addition, she will start to save for the future and to reinvest in her business.

loan.use: To purchase bread, juice, lotion, fruit and other food items

loan.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna K. is an experienced accountant. While preparing accounting reports for her market trader clients, she realized owning a business can be profitable, and she started her own business. In one year, Susanna doubled her working capital by reinvesting the profit into the business. Susannas family members are all hard-working and highly motivated people. Susanna has applied for this loan to increase the working capital which will allow her to have quick pre-holiday sales and fast loan repayment.

loan.use: Increasing working capital

loan.name: Varuzhan

texts.en: Varuzhan N. is a successful self-starter. He owns a wedding and funeral business in his small town where he is very popular for his quality and affordable services. Varuzhans wife is a school teacher and together they have two children. The family would like to save some money to finish off their house. As the pre-holiday season is very busy with weddings, Varuzhan would like to increase his working capital to meet the demand and make a good profit during this season.

loan.use: Increasing working capital for pre-holiday season

loan.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 37 years old and married. She sells clothes to earn a living. She started the business in 2007 and has seen a lot of growth in the business since she joined Faulu Kenya. This is because of the previous 30,000 Kenyan shilling (Kes) loan from Faulu Kenya, which she used to add stock.
She has requested another loan of 30,000 Kes to buy clothes, handbags and shoes.

loan.use: To buy clothes, handbags and shoes

loan.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 48 years old and is married with five children who are between 11 and 25 years old. She also takes care of eight dependents who are between 4 and 25 years old.
Bernadette has been making a living by selling drinks she makes from sorghum. This is her twentieth year in business and she currently employs three people. The hours of her business are from 7 am to 7:30 pm, and she works every day but on the weekend she works only in the afternoons.
Although Bernadette has twenty years of experience in this business, her earned profits are still too low to care for her children and dependents. She plans to use this loan to purchase a large quantity of sorghum to make a large quantity of drinks. Any profits she makes will be used to buy a house and pay school fees for her children.

loan.use: To buy a large quantity of sorghum to make more drinks to sell.

loan.name: Kua Guapa Joaju Group

texts.es:
El comit Kua Guapa Joaju se form con la unin de varias vecinas de Capiibary. Todas las integrantes del comit desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, Despensa, cra de animales. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compaerismo y al adquirir el crdito se le abren muchas puertas Para el progreso de sus emprendimientos.
La Sra. Celestina C. es una de las integrantes del comit, ella posee una despensa y cras de animales. Ella realiza varias actividades, es una seora muy creativa en su actividad, y as ella logra ayudar a su familia. Es una seora muy trabajadora y siempre trata de dar lo mejor a su familia. Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo. La seora solicita el crdito para la compra de balanceados etc.
texts.en:
The Cua Guapa Joaju committee was formed by a number of neighbors from the city of Capiibary. All the members of the committee carry out independent business activities such as sales, running a grocery store and raising animals.
The members of this group are very united and capable of jointly carrying out activities that strengthen their team spirit. The loan they receive will open many doors for them. It will help them to make progress in their businesses.
Celestina C. is one of the committee's members. She owns a grocery store and also raises animals. She carries out several business activities and is a very creative woman. Through her business activities, she manages to help her family. Celestina is a very hard-working woman who always tries to provide her family with the best. She is very happy with her business activities and also with the training that her group receives. She is requesting this loan to buy balanced animal feed.

loan.use: To buy balanced animal feed

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Callixte

texts.en:
Callixte is 36 years old and single. Callixte has five years of experience in repairing doors. He employs 3 people and his business is open from 6:30 am until 5:30 pm.
Callixte has requested a loan from Kiva via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business. With this loan, Callixte believes he will obtain more profit in repairing doors, which he will reinvest in his business. He also hopes to buy a house in the future.

loan.use: To expand his business

loan.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 30-year-old farmer. She has been farming for the past four years. The climate of Kiambu is favorable for farming; hence, she is able to practice mixed farming. She went into the farming business after leaving her career as a teacher.
She hopes to be a prosperous farmer in the future. She has requested 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loan.use: To buy a dairy cow

loan.name: Monicah Wanjiku

texts.en:
Monicah Wanjiku has been selling timber as her primary business. She also has a butcher shop in Githurai and earns a profit margin of Kshs.27,617 per month. She is married to Fredrick and together they have three children aged between 9 and 18 years.
This is her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to KADET by a friend. She plans to use the loan as follows: buy timber worth Kshs.50,000 and use Kshs.30,000 to buy more meat to sell at the butcher shop.
She will use the anticipated profit to re-invest in the businesses, so she will have enough stock to sell to her customers. In the future she hopes to grow her businesses and open another branch of the timber yard. In the future, she plans to build a house.

loan.use: To buy more timber to sell

loan.name: C5293 Inyenyeri Group

texts.en:
Celestin is 36 years old and is married with two children who are 4 and 8 years old. He is the president of a group called Inyenyeri and he sells bananas. This is his third successful year in this business, which he operate from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day.
Celestin and his team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of increasing the quantity of bananas he sells to the market. With this expansion, he really hopes that the earned profits will increase. In addition, he will start saving and be able to satisfy the basic needs of his family.

loan.use: To buy a large quantity of bananas

loan.name: Arminda

texts.es: La Sra. Arminda tiene una despensa muy bien surtida en la esquina misma del asentamiento la Gloria sobre la ruta Sto. Zaracho de Cnel. Oviedo. La misma manifiesta que tiene una muy buena clientela porque tiene casi de todo en su despensa y le trata muy bien a sus clientes. Esta en pareja con el Sr Anbal Cceres el mismo trabaja como mototaxista y as se ayudan mutuamente. Tambin comenta que est muy agradecida con la entidad por haber confiado en su persona porque gracias al prstamo que le ha otorgado rpidamente la fundacin ya compro todas las mercaderas que le faltaba y est trabajando tranquilamente ahora en su negocio.
texts.en:
Arminda has a very well stocked grocery store on the corner of La Gloria settlement on Sto. Zaracho de Cnel. Oviedo road.
Arminda tells us that she has a very good customer base because she stocks almost everything in her store and she treats her customers very well. She lives with her partner, Anbal Cceres, who works as a driver of a 'mototaxi' (a motorbike with a cabin in back for transporting passengers and cargo). They both help each other.
Arminda also tells us that she is very grateful that we have placed our trust in her because, thanks to the loan that we quickly provided her with, she has already bought all of the merchandise that she needed and is now working peacefully in her business.

loan.use: To buy sugar, baked goods, oils and noodles

loan.name: Lus

texts.es:
Lus C. P. tiene 48 aos. Es soltero, vive con los padres y con los hermanos, vive en el cantn de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolvar. No tiene hijos.
Los miembros de la V.R.C. JESUS DEL GRAN PODER, Comunidad de San Ramn esta ubicada en el cantn Chillanes, a 35 minutos de la Oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican exclusivamente a la agricultura.
Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maz y frjol. Las compras y ventas las realiza en el Cantn Chillanes en la feria de los das Domingos.
Solicita el crdito para la comprar de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes para que la produccin sea de calidad. Con el apoyo del crdito le ayudara econmicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueo es comprar un terreno para construir la casa.
Le gusta escuchar msica romntica y salir al campo.
texts.en:
Lus C. P. is 48 years old. He is single and lives with his parents and his siblings. He lives in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolvar. He does not have children.
The members of the community bank "Jesus del Gran Poder" meet in the community of San Ramn in the canton of Chillanes, 35 minutes from the Chillanes office. The members of this group all work in agriculture.
Luis dedicates himself to growing corn and beans. He shops and sells each Sunday at the local fair in the canton of Chillanes.
He is requesting this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers so that his crop is high quality. The support of this credit will help him economically to meet his necessary expenses. He faces challenges such as plagues, sicknesses, and a variable climate. Luis' dream is to buy a plot of land to construct his own home. He enjoys listening to romantic music and going out to the country.

loan.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loan.name: Samuel

texts.en: Greetings from Samuel in Kigali, Rwanda! Samuel is 28 years old, single and has two adopted orphans. Samuel has been a motorbike taxi driver for six years. He transports people all day from 6am until 11pm. He currently has to rent the use of the motorbike and would like to use this loan to purchase his own motorbike. He would like to send the two children who depend on him to school and build a house for the family.

loan.use: To buy a motorbike

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To open a shop

loan.name: Damaris

texts.en: Damaris is a 30-year-old mother of three. She has been operating a salon for three years and has managed to employ two people in her business. She also relies on her husband for financial support. She hopes to open a big beauty parlor in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a hair dryer.

loan.use: to buy a hair dryer

loan.name: C1620 Abisunganye Group

texts.en:
Alivera is 55 years old and is married with three children who are 12 and 6 years old. She is the president of a group called Abisunganye. Alivera sells bananas, and others in the group have businesses selling beans at the local market. Alivera employs six people in her business and has been working for 10 years in this line of work.
Alivera plans to use this loan to buy more bananas to sell at the market. She would like to use any profits to start saving and to satisfy the basic needs of her family.

loan.use: To buy a large quantity of fruits and vegetables to sell

loan.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is 34 years old. He is married and has one child. He also cares for one adopted child. Bernard sells household products, such as spoons, plates, pans and other useful items. He also employs one other person to help him in the store. Bernard will use this loan to increase his stock of housewares. With any profit he makes, he plans to build a house.

loan.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loan.name: Bernarda

texts.es: La Sra. Bernarda es comerciante hace mas de 5 aos tiene en su propia casa una despensa bien surtida est ubicado en el barrio Azucena de Cnel. Oviedo, adems tiene en su negocio artculos de Mercera y tambin vende comestible en frente de su casa. La misma est casada con Don Ramn Rojas hace ms de 20 aos, el mismo es jubilado y percibe sueldo del estado. La misma tambin manifiesta que no se queja de sus ventas ya que tiene muchos clientes todo el da porque al lado de su negocio hay dos talleres grandes y llega mucha gente. Agradece a la Fundacin Paraguaya por haber confiado en su persona dndole la oportunidad de formar parte de la gran familia de micro-empresas a quienes les ofrecen fondos para el capital de trabajo. Ella solicito el prstamo para la compra de mercaderas varias para su negocio.
texts.en:
Bernarda is a saleswoman. For more than five years she has had a small, well-stocked grocery store in her home in Azucena de Cnel. Oviedo neighborhood. She also sells hardware in her store and sells food in front of her home.
Bernarda has been married to Ramn Rojas for more than 20 years. He is now retired and receives a state pension. Bernarda tells us that she has no complaints as regards her sales. She has lots of customers all day long as there are two large workshops next to her business and a lot of people come to her store.
Bernarda is grateful to Fundacin Paraguaya for having placed their trust in her, giving her an opportunity to form part of a large family of small businesses to whom they offer funds for working capital. Bernarda requested her loan to buy merchandise for her business.

loan.use: To buy soda, bread, flour, sugar and noodles

loan.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 41 years old and married. She has 4 children between 9 and 17 years old and she cares for 3 orphans who are between 18 and 24 years old. Mediatrice is in retail sales at Nyabugogo Market in Kigali. She has been in this business for about 10 years. Her business is open from 6:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. most days and she currently employs one other person to help her run the store.
Mediatrice has requested a Kiva loan that will allow her to increase her sales by purchasing more products for her store. With the additional business, which hopefully will attract many customers, Mediatrice will keep expanding her business with a vision of being financially stable.

loan.use: To purchase more products to sell

loan.name: Aukor Lokwang

texts.en:
Aukor Lokwang N. is 37 years old. He is married to Lilian Alim, who is a housewife. They have three school-going children ages ten, seven, and four years old. They live in Lodwar, Kenya.
Aukor sells livestock and has been in this business for six years. He earns a monthly profit of KES.10, 000.
Aukor learned about KADET LTD through a credit officer. He is applying for a second loan of KES. 50,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to buy more goats,cows,sheeps to sell. He plans to use the anticipated profits to expand his livestock business.
In the future, Aukor wishes to expand economically and be the leading local investor.

loan.use: To buy more goats, cows, sheep to sell

loan.name: Argam

texts.en: Argam G. is married and has three children. Two of his children attend school and one is a university student. Argam, his wife and his parents are farmers who also raise cattle. As his children grow, the familys needs grow, too. Next year, Argams second daughter will become a university student, so the family requires additional income. Argam is planning to use his loan to expand his livestock business.

loan.use: Expand his livestock business

loan.name: Fredy

texts.es: El Sr. Fredy vive en Quebrada el Tigre desde hace 12 aos trabajando agricultura, tambin se dedica a la siembra de ctricos como naranja, mandarina en la agricultura siembra maz, yuca, man y arroz tambin se dedica a la ganadera. El seor hace 3 aos que trabaja solo con Emprender por que se le dio facilidad de pago, el dinero del crdito lo utilizara en la compra de semillas y preparado de la tierra para siembra de arroz, es muy trabajador y esta agradecida con la institucin por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Fredy has lived in Quebrada el Tigre for 12 years, working as a farmer. He grows citrus fruits such as oranges and mandarins; corn, cassava, peanuts and rice. He also raises livestock.
Fredy has been working with Emprender for 3 years because they offered him credit facilities. He will use the money from this loan to buy seeds and to prepare his land for sowing rice. He is a very hard-working man and is grateful to the institution for the support they have provided.

loan.use: To sow rice

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase machinery to cut stones

loan.name: San Cayetano I Group

texts.es: Este Comit se formo a travs de las Sras. Modesta Martnez y la Sra. Francisca O., quienes se haba acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundacin Paraguaya para interiorizarse ms del Programa de Comit de Mujeres Emprendedoras, la misma invito a sus amigas y compaeras del Barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para salir adelante y as mejorar su estilo de vida, son mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los das. Ellas son independientes en sus labores como vendedoras de ropas, venta de comidas, tienen Despensa, Almacn, Copetn, y Casillas, tienen huertas comunitarias y comercializan sus propios productos. Una de las integrantes es la seora Felicia quien se dedica a la elaboracin de dulce de man, y as logra obtener el ingreso para ayudar a su familia y al mismo tiempo pagar sus cuotas. Sus clientes conforman varios negocios de la zona, y solicita el prstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboracin de dulces como man, azcar, leche y otros.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Modesta Martnez and Francisca O. who approached Fundacin Paraguaya's Office to find out more about the Enterprising Women's Committee Program. They invited their friends and acquaintances from their neighborhood and formed a group to get ahead and improve their lifestyles. These are hard-working and humble women who must earn money to support themselves every day.
The women work independently in their different business activities which include selling clothes, selling meals, running a grocery store, wholesaler's, caf, and sales booths. They have community market gardens and they sell their own produce.
One of the committee's members is Felicia who makes 'dulce de man' (a kind of peanut brittle) which makes her income with which she can help her family and also meet her loan repayments. Felicia's customers are different businesses in the area. She is requesting this loan to buy supplies so that she can keep making her 'dulce de man' such as peanuts, sugar, milk, etc.

loan.use: To buy peanuts, sugar, milk, etc.

loan.name: Jorge

texts.es: El seor Jorge I. es moto taxista, trabaja hace 3 aos, tiene una parada que tiene a su nombre, trabaja desde las 5 de la maana hasta las 8 de la noche. Es un joven muy luchador que esta invirtiendo su dinero para mantener su motocicleta para darle mas buenos servicios a sus clientes. Es un ejemplo de joven humilde trabajador y emprendedor. Valora mucho el apoyo que la institucin le ha ofrecido con este prstamo y asegura que sera siempre un buen cliente. Solita el prestamo para la compra de repuestos y acceorios para la moto.
texts.en:
Jorge I. provides taxi services with his motorbike. He has been doing this job for 3 years. He has his own stand and works from 5.00am to 8.00pm. He is a very hard-working young man who is investing his money in maintaining his motorbike so that he can provide his customers with a better service.
Jorge is the very model of a hard-working and enterprising young man. He greatly values the support that our institution has offered him with this loan and he assures us that he will always be a good client. He is requesting this loan to buy spare parts and accessories for his motorbike.
